oldUacValue.description: Old UAC value, representing the User Account Control (UAC) value of the user account before the change. This value is in hexadecimal string format, typically starting with the '0x' prefix followed by one or more hexadecimal digits (0-9, A-F).

newUacValue.label: New UAC Value
newUacValue.description: The new UAC value represents the User Account Control (UAC) value after modification. This field is of string type and is typically represented in hexadecimal format.

delegationList.label: Delegation List
delegationList.description: This field indicates the list of objects to which a user or service principal is allowed to delegate their permissions or authorization. The value is a string that must conform to a specific Service Principal Name (SPN) format. The format is typically 'service class/hostname[:port]', where 'service class' identifies the type of service, 'hostname' is a fully qualified domain name (FQDN) or NetBIOS name, and 'port' is optional.

userAccountControl.label: User Account Control
userAccountControl.description: The User Account Control attribute is a bitmask in Windows Active Directory that represents various account settings. This field is of string type and is typically expressed as a hexadecimal or decimal string.

userParameters.label: User Parameters
userParameters.description: Custom configuration parameters for Active Directory user accounts.

incidentId.label: Incident ID
incidentId.description: The Event ID is a globally unique identifier for security incidents, typically generated using non-repetitive algorithms such as UUID or timestamp sequences to ensure its uniqueness.

incidentName.label: Incident Name
incidentName.description: This field is used to identify the brief summary name of the security event.

incidentLevel.label: Incident Level
incidentLevel.description: Severity level of a security event, used to assess the impact scope and urgency of the incident. The value range is an enumeration type with the following options: Critical, High, Medium, Low. Strictly use the provided enumeration values.

Critical.label: Critical
Critical.description: Security incidents causing significant business impact require immediate response.

High.label: High
High.description: Security incidents that have a significant impact on business operations require priority handling.

Medium.label: Medium
Medium.description: Security incidents that have a certain impact on business operations need to be handled according to the plan.

Low.label: Low
Low.description: Low-impact security incidents that can be processed according to standard procedures.

incidentStatus.label: Incident Status
incidentStatus.description: Indicates the current processing status of the security event in the response lifecycle. This field is of enumeration type, and its value must be a predefined string. Optional values include: Analysising (Analyzing), Error (Error), Ignore (Ignored), Pending (Pending), Disposed (Disposed).

Error.label: Error
Error.description: Event of automated playbook execution flow termination due to errors during the analysis process

Ignore.label: Ignore
Ignore.description: Events that have been analyzed and determined to require no action.

Disposed.label: Disposed
Disposed.description: The incident that has been completed and closed for disposition.

closeTime.label: Close Time
closeTime.description: The closeTime field indicates the timestamp when the incident handling is completed and officially closed. This field is of string type and must strictly adhere to the datetime format: yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm:ss, e.g., 2025-01-14 11:18:31.

assignee.label: Assignee
assignee.description: The responsible person field is used to identify the primary individual accountable for security incident investigation and response. The value should be of string type, typically representing the responsible person's username, employee ID, or full name.

participants.label: Participants
participants.description: This field records a list of all personnel involved in security incident response and handling, stored in string array format.

isInternetAttack.label: Is Internet Attack
isInternetAttack.description: This field is used to identify whether the attack source originates from an external network on the internet. The field type is boolean, with possible values of true or false, where true indicates the attack source is from the internet, and false indicates the attack source is not from the internet.

incidentDataSource.label: Incident Data Source
incidentDataSource.description: The security event data source field is used to identify the original source system and detection mechanism of security event data, such as security devices, log systems, threat intelligence platforms, or manual reports.

incidentType.label: Incident Type
incidentType.description: The security event type field is used to identify the primary attack classification and technical category of a security event, represented in a hierarchical path format. This field is of enumeration type and must be selected from predefined optional values, with each value being a string-formatted path.

/Malware/ComputerVirus.label: Malware Computer Virus Event
/Malware/ComputerVirus.description: Computer virus incident: creating, disseminating, or exploiting malicious programs to affect computer usage, impair computer functionality, destroy or steal data.

/Malware/Worm.label: Malware Worm Event
/Malware/Worm.description: Network worm incident: Exploiting network vulnerabilities to deliberately create or automatically replicate and propagate network worms through the network.

/Malware/Trojan.label: Malware Trojan
/Malware/Trojan.description: Trojan horse incident: The creation, dissemination, or exploitation of malicious programs with remote control capabilities to illegally steal or intercept data.

/Malware/Botnet.label: Malware Botnet Event
/Malware/Botnet.description: Botnet event: Formation of a botnet using bot tools.

/Malware/MaliciousCodeEmbedded.label: Malware Malicious Code Embedded
/Malware/MaliciousCodeEmbedded.description: Malicious code embedded webpage incident: When accessing a compromised webpage embedded with malicious code, the code installs malware on the computer systems of visitors to that webpage.

/Malware/MaliciousCodeHostingSite.label: Malware Hosting Site
/Malware/MaliciousCodeHostingSite.description: Malicious code hosting site incident: Luring target users to download malicious code from a hosting site that stores malicious code.

/Malware/Ransomware.label: Malware Ransomware Event
/Malware/Ransomware.description: Ransomware incident: Hijacks users' access rights to systems or data through encryption or blocking user operations, thereby demanding ransom payments from users.

/Malware/Miner.label: Malware Miner Event
/Malware/Miner.description: Cryptocurrency mining malware incident: A type of cyberattack aimed at obtaining digital cryptocurrencies by compromising and controlling others' computers to implant mining malware programs for performing large-scale computations.

/Malware/BlendedAttack.label: Malware Blended Attack
/Malware/BlendedAttack.description: Hybrid attack program event: Utilizes multiple methods to propagate and exploit various malicious programs. For example, a computer virus infiltrates a computer system and subsequently installs a Trojan horse program within the system.

/Malware/Others.label: Malware Others
/Malware/Others.description: Other malware incidents: Malware events that do not fall into the above subcategories.

/NetAttack/Scan.label: Network Scan Event
/NetAttack/Scan.description: Network scanning detection event: Using network scanning software to obtain information about network configuration, ports, services, and existing vulnerabilities.

/NetAttack/Phishing.label: Network Attack Phishing
/NetAttack/Phishing.description: Phishing incident: The use of fraudulent network techniques to deceive users into disclosing sensitive data or personal information.

/NetAttack/VulnExploit.label: Network Attack Vulnerability Exploit
/NetAttack/VulnExploit.description: Exploitation event: Conducting network attacks by identifying and exploiting vulnerabilities such as network configuration flaws, communication protocol weaknesses, or application defects.

/NetAttack/BackdoorExploit.label: Net Attack Backdoor Exploit
/NetAttack/BackdoorExploit.description: Backdoor exploitation incident: Malicious utilization of interfaces, functional modules, programs, etc. left unverified during the design process of software or hardware systems to illegally obtain network administrative privileges.

/NetAttack/BackdoorImplantation.label: Network Attack Backdoor Implantation
/NetAttack/BackdoorImplantation.description: Backdoor implantation incident: Illegally creating a backdoor in the network to persistently gain administrative privileges.

/NetAttack/Credential.label: Network Attack Credential
/NetAttack/Credential.description: Credential attack incident: Password cracking. Involves parsing login passwords or credentials.

/NetAttack/SignalInterference.label: Network Attack Signal Interference
/NetAttack/SignalInterference.description: Signal interference incident: The use of technical means to obstruct the normal propagation of wired or wireless signals within a network.

/NetAttack/DOS.label: /Netattack/Dos
/NetAttack/DOS.description: Denial of Service (DoS) incident: Affecting or disrupting network availability by abnormal consumption of network resources (such as CPU, memory, disk space, or network bandwidth), for example: DDoS attacks, etc.

/NetAttack/WebTempering.label: Web Page Tampering Event
/NetAttack/WebTempering.description: Web page defacement incident: Maliciously damaging or altering web page content to impact website reputation or compromise the availability of web pages and websites.

/NetAttack/DomainHijack.label: Network Attack Domain Hijack
/NetAttack/DomainHijack.description: Domain hijacking incident: A deliberate or malicious act of redirecting users to unintended specified IP addresses (websites) through DNS attacks or spoofing.

/NetAttack/DomainRedirect.label: Domain Redirect Attack
/NetAttack/DomainRedirect.description: Domain hijacking incident: Pointing one's own domain name to an IP address that does not belong to them, causing all attacks targeting that domain to be redirected to the specified IP address.

/NetAttack/DNSPoisoning.label: DNS Poisoning Event
/NetAttack/DNSPoisoning.description: DNS poisoning incident: Using deliberately crafted or inadvertently generated DNS packets to redirect domain names to incorrect IP addresses.

/NetAttack/WLANHijack.label: WLAN Hijack Event
/NetAttack/WLANHijack.description: WLAN hijacking incident: Illegally obtaining control permissions of a wireless local area network through methods such as password cracking and firmware replacement.

/NetAttack/TrafficHijack.label: Network Attack Traffic Hijack
/NetAttack/TrafficHijack.description: Traffic hijacking incident: Causing user traffic loss by maliciously inducing or illegally forcing users to access specific network resources.

/NetAttack/BGPHijack.label: BGP Hijack Attack Event
/NetAttack/BGPHijack.description: BGP hijacking attack incident: Malicious manipulation of network routing paths through BGP.

/NetAttack/BroadcastFraud.label: Broadcast Fraud Event
/NetAttack/BroadcastFraud.description: Broadcast spoofing incident: Disrupting normal network packet transmission or stealing sensitive information from network users through broadcast spoofing techniques.

/NetAttack/CompromisedHost.label: Net Attack Compromised Host
/NetAttack/CompromisedHost.description: Compromised host incident: After gaining control of a host, attackers can use it as a springboard to further attack other hosts within the organization's internal network.

/NetAttack/SupplyChain.label: Supply Chain Attack Event
/NetAttack/SupplyChain.description: Supply chain attack incident: Distributing malware by exploiting vulnerabilities in supply chain management to infect legitimate applications.

/NetAttack/APT.label: APT Event
/NetAttack/APT.description: APT (Advanced Persistent Threat) incident: A sustained and effective attack campaign targeting specific entities. This type of attack is highly covert and targeted, typically employing various means such as infected media, supply chain compromises, and social engineering to carry out sophisticated, persistent, and effective threats and attacks.

/NetAttack/Others.label: Other Network Attack Events
/NetAttack/Others.description: Other network attack events: Network attack events that do not fall into the above subcategories.

/DataSec/DataTampering.label: Data Security Data Tampering Event
/DataSec/DataTampering.description: Data tampering incident: unauthorized access or modification of data;

/DataSec/DataFake.label: Data Falsification Event
/DataSec/DataFake.description: Data spoofing incident: Unauthorized or illegal use and forgery of data.

/DataSec/DataLeakage.label: Data Security Data Leakage Event
/DataSec/DataLeakage.description: Data breach incident: Unintentional or malicious exposure of data or sensitive personal information to unauthorized parties through technical means.

/DataSec/SocialEngineering.label: Data Security Social Engineering Event
/DataSec/SocialEngineering.description: Social engineering incident: Inducing individuals to disclose data or perform actions through non-technical means (e.g., psychology, persuasion techniques, etc.).

/DataSec/DataTheft.label: Data Security Data Theft Event
/DataSec/DataTheft.description: Data theft incident: Unauthorized acquisition of data through technical means (e.g., eavesdropping, espionage, etc.).

/DataSec/DataIntercept.label: Data Interception Event
/DataSec/DataIntercept.description: Data interception event: Illegally capturing data before it reaches the intended recipient.

/DataSec/PositionDetection.label: Data Security Position Detection Event
/DataSec/PositionDetection.description: Location detection event: unauthorized detection of systems, personal geolocation information, or storage locations of sensitive data.

/DataSec/DataPoisoning.label: Data Poisoning Event
/DataSec/DataPoisoning.description: The probability distribution of training data may cause the model to produce classification or clustering errors under certain specific conditions.

/DataSec/DataAbuse.label: Data Security Data Abuse Event
/DataSec/DataAbuse.description: Data abuse incident: unintentional or malicious misuse of data

/DataSec/PrivacyInvasion.label: Privacy Invasion Event
/DataSec/PrivacyInvasion.description: Privacy breach incident: Unintentional or malicious infringement of sensitive personal information present in the network.

/DataSec/DataLoss.label: Data Loss Event
/DataSec/DataLoss.description: Data loss incident: Loss of data caused by factors such as misoperation, deliberate human actions, or software/hardware defects.

/DataSec/Others.label: Data Security Other Events
/DataSec/Others.description: Other data security incidents: Data security incidents not falling into the above subcategories.

/InformationSec/Reactionary.label: Information Security Reactionary
/InformationSec/Reactionary.description: Counter-revolutionary propaganda incidents: The use of online platforms to disseminate illegal information that incites subversion of state power, overthrow of the socialist system, instigation of secession, undermining of national unity, and other activities that endanger national security, honor, and interests.

/InformationSec/Violent.label: Information Security Violent Content
/InformationSec/Violent.description: Terrorism propaganda incident: Using the internet to propagate terrorism and extremism, inciting ethnic hatred and discrimination, causing social panic and unrest.

/InformationSec/Porn.label: Information Security Pornography Incident
/InformationSec/Porn.description: Pornography dissemination incident: Using the internet to spread obscene and pornographic information that violates social ethics and morals.

/InformationSec/FalseInformation.label: Information Security False Information
/InformationSec/FalseInformation.description: Disinformation dissemination incident: Fabricating and spreading false information online to disrupt economic and social order, resulting in negative impacts.

/InformationSec/RightsInfringement.label: Information Security Rights Infringement Event
/InformationSec/RightsInfringement.description: Rights infringement incident: The use of network-transmitted information to infringe upon the legitimate rights and interests of social organizations or citizens.

/InformationSec/InformationSpamming.label: Information Security Spamming Event
/InformationSec/InformationSpamming.description: Spamming incident: The act of disseminating unsolicited information via networks without the recipient's consent, such as spam emails, etc.

/InformationSec/NetworkFraud.label: Information Security Network Fraud Event
/InformationSec/NetworkFraud.description: Cyber fraud incident: The malicious use of technical or non-technical means to defraud specific or non-specific targets via the internet for the purpose of illegally obtaining information or money.

/InformationSec/Others.label: Information Security Other Events
/InformationSec/Others.description: Other information content security incidents: Information content security incidents not covered by the above subcategories.

/DevOps/TechnicalFailure.label: DevOps Technical Failure Event
/DevOps/TechnicalFailure.description: Technical failure event: System failures caused by inherent defects in network hardware/software, design flaws, or changes in operating environments, such as hardware failures, software failures, overload conditions, etc.

/DevOps/InfrastructureFailure.label: DevOps Infrastructure Failure
/DevOps/InfrastructureFailure.description: Supporting facility failure incident: Malfunction of auxiliary facilities supporting network operations. Examples include power supply failures, lighting system failures, temperature and humidity control system failures, etc.

/DevOps/PhysicalDamage.label: DevOps Physical Damage Event
/DevOps/PhysicalDamage.description: Physical damage incident: Deliberate or accidental physical actions causing damage to the network environment or network equipment. Examples include fire, water leakage, static electricity, equipment destruction or loss, etc.

/DevOps/Radiation.label: DevOps Radiation Interference Event
/DevOps/Radiation.description: Radiation interference incident: Interference caused by radiation affecting normal network operations. Examples include electromagnetic radiation, electromagnetic pulses, electronic interference, voltage fluctuations, thermal radiation, etc.

/DevOps/Others.label: DevOps Other Events
/DevOps/Others.description: Other device facility failure events: Device facility failure events that do not fall into the above subcategories.

/ViolateOp/PrivilegeAbuse.label: Privilege Abuse Event
/ViolateOp/PrivilegeAbuse.description: Privilege abuse incident: Attackers exploit excessive functionality exposure or lax permission restrictions on the network server to conduct attacks through direct or indirect privilege invocation.

/ViolateOp/PrivilegeEscalation.label: Privilege Escalation Event
/ViolateOp/PrivilegeEscalation.description: Permission forgery incident: Creating false permissions for deception purposes.

/ViolateOp/BehaviorDenial.label: Violation Operation Behavior Denial Event
/ViolateOp/BehaviorDenial.description: Repudiation event: The user denies their malicious actions.

/ViolateOp/Deliberate.label: Deliberate Violation Operation
/ViolateOp/Deliberate.description: Intentional violation incident: deliberately performing illegal operations;

/ViolateOp/Misoperation.label: Misoperation Event
/ViolateOp/Misoperation.description: Misoperation event: unintentionally performing incorrect actions.

/ViolateOp/PersonnelAvailability.label: Violate Operation Personnel Availability
/ViolateOp/PersonnelAvailability.description: Personnel availability disruption incident: Human resources are compromised, resulting in personnel absence or unavailability.

/ViolateOp/UnauthResource.label: Unauthorized Resource Access Event
/ViolateOp/UnauthResource.description: Unauthorized resource usage incident: unauthorized access to resources.

/ViolateOp/Copyright.label: Copyright Violation Event
/ViolateOp/Copyright.description: Copyright violation incident: Installation and use of commercial software or other copyrighted materials in violation of copyright requirements.

/ViolateOp/Others.label: Violation Operation Others
/ViolateOp/Others.description: Other violation events: Violation events that do not fall into the above subcategories.

/SafetyHazard/NetVuln.label: Network Vulnerability Event
/SafetyHazard/NetVuln.description: Network vulnerability incident: Security risks arising from insufficient consideration of security during the development and design process of operating systems, applications, or security protocols.

/SafetyHazard/NetConfigFlaw.label: Safety Hazard Network Configuration Flaw
/SafetyHazard/NetConfigFlaw.description: Network configuration compliance defect event: Security vulnerabilities or risks caused by improper or default security configurations of software/hardware that fail to meet cybersecurity requirements.

/SafetyHazard/Others.label: Safety Hazard Others
/SafetyHazard/Others.description: Other security risk events: Security risk incidents not categorized under the above subclasses.

/AbnormalBehavior/Access.label: Abnormal Behavior Access Event
/AbnormalBehavior/Access.description: Access exception event: Service interruption caused by changes in the network software/hardware operating environment.

/AbnormalBehavior/Traffic.label: Abnormal Behavior Traffic Event
/AbnormalBehavior/Traffic.description: Traffic anomaly event: Network traffic behavior pattern deviates from the normal baseline.

/AbnormalBehavior/Others.label: Abnormal Behavior Others
/AbnormalBehavior/Others.description: Other anomalous behavior events: anomalous behavior events that do not fall into the above subcategories.

/Majeure/NaturalDisaster.label: Natural Disaster Event
/Majeure/NaturalDisaster.description: Natural disaster events: Extreme natural phenomena that cause damage to information and information systems, such as earthquakes, volcanoes, floods, storms, lightning, tsunamis, landslides, etc.

/Majeure/IncidentDisaster.label: Major Incident Disaster
/Majeure/IncidentDisaster.description: Disaster incident: An accident with catastrophic consequences resulting in damage to information and information systems, such as public facility and equipment accidents, environmental pollution incidents, etc.

/Majeure/PublicHealth.label: Public Health Event
/Majeure/PublicHealth.description: Public health incidents: Infectious disease outbreaks and similar events that cause damage to information and information systems.

/Majeure/SocialSec.label: Social Security Event
/Majeure/SocialSec.description: Social security incident: Emergent mass incidents that endanger the state and society, resulting in damage to information and information systems. Examples include terrorist attacks, etc.

/Majeure/Others.label: Force Majeure Events
/Majeure/Others.description: Other force majeure events: Force majeure events not included in the above subcategories.

/Others/Others.label: Other Events
/Others/Others.description: Other events refer to cybersecurity incidents that are not classified into the above categories.

sshClientVersion.label: SSH Client Version
sshClientVersion.description: Protocol version identifier used by the SSH client, typically indicating the major version number of the SSH protocol.

sshServerVersion.label: SSH Server Version
sshServerVersion.description: This field represents the protocol version identifier declared by the SSH server during the protocol handshake process, used to identify the SSH protocol version supported by the server.

filePermissions.label: File Permissions
filePermissions.description: The access permissions for files or directories, represented using Unix-style symbolic notation, typically consist of 9 characters. These denote read, write, and execute permissions for the owner, group, and others respectively. Common formats include strings like `rw-r--r--`, where `r` stands for read, `w` for write, `x` for execute, and `-` indicates the absence of the corresponding permission.

fileOwner.label: File Owner
fileOwner.description: The owner username of the file, formatted as a string type, typically a valid username in the operating system. Supported characters include letters, numbers, underscores, and other common characters.

fileGroup.label: File Group
fileGroup.description: The group ownership of a file or directory, indicating the group permission attribution of the file within the system.

cpuModel.label: CPU Model
cpuModel.description: CPU model, indicating the specific model specifications of the central processing unit, including information such as manufacturer, architecture, and model.

gpuModel.label: GPU Model
gpuModel.description: Graphics processor model identifier, containing manufacturer, architecture, and compute capability specifications. This field is of string type and typically represents the manufacturer-defined specific model name.

imageName.label: Image Name
imageName.description: Image name refers to the complete image identifier used during container runtime, which must include the repository address, image name, and tag. The format must be a string, typically following the `[repository-address/]image-name:tag` convention.

namespace.label: Namespace
namespace.description: A namespace is a logical isolation unit within a Kubernetes cluster, used for resource grouping and access control. This field is of string type, and its value must comply with Kubernetes namespace naming conventions.

cpuLimit.label: CPU Limit
cpuLimit.description: This field indicates the upper limit of CPU resources available to the container, which can be specified in either mCPU units or number of cores. Format requirements: If using mCPU units, the value must be followed by a lowercase 'm', e.g., '500m' represents 500 millicores (i.e., 0.5 cores). If using number of cores, an integer or decimal can be used directly, e.g., '0.5' or '1'. The value is of string type.

storageLimit.label: Storage Limit
storageLimit.description: The upper limit of available storage resources, which requires specifying a numerical value and unit. Supported units include Gi, Ti, etc. For example, 10Gi represents 10 gibibytes. The format requires a number followed by a unit identifier, with the unit in uppercase (e.g., Gi, Ti), and the numerical value must be positive.

podName.label: Pod Name
podName.description: The Pod name is the unique identifier of Pod resources in a Kubernetes cluster. This field is of string type and its naming must comply with Kubernetes naming conventions.

componentName.label: Component Name
componentName.description: The component name serves as the functional name identifier for internal system components, used to uniquely identify a software module or functional unit. Format requirements: must be a valid string, typically composed of lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens (-), following common naming conventions (such as Maven artifactId or package names).

portStatus.label: Port Status
portStatus.description: Port status indicates the current operational state of a network port. This field is of enumeration type, and its value must be a predefined string. The available options include: open, closed, filtered, unfiltered.

closed.label: Closed
closed.description: Port is not listening for connections

filtered.label: Filtered
filtered.description: Port is accessible but status is unknown

unfiltered.label: Unfiltered
unfiltered.description: Port is accessible but status is unknown

userLoginHours.label: User Login Hours
userLoginHours.description: User account login time restriction, which defines the time range during which users can log in to the system.

originalPageUrl.label: Original Page URL
originalPageUrl.description: The original webpage URL refers to the URL address of the legitimate webpage before tampering, used to identify the original access path prior to the webpage tampering incident. This field must comply with standard URL specifications, typically including the protocol (e.g., http or https), domain name or IP address, port (optional), path, and query parameters (optional).

tamperedPageUrl.label: Tampered Page URL
tamperedPageUrl.description: This field records the URL address of the compromised webpage after unauthorized modification. The format must comply with standard URL specifications, typically including components such as the protocol type (e.g., http, https), domain name, and path.

assetId.label: Asset ID
assetId.description: Asset ID is the globally unique identifier of an asset in the system, formatted as a string.

appName.label: Application Name
appName.description: This field represents the name of the accessed or referenced application, used to identify the application or service that generated the log. The value is of string type, typically being a custom name or identifier of the application.

accountName.label: Account Name
accountName.description: The account name is the readable identifier of a user account in the system. It is formatted as a string, typically composed of letters, numbers, and certain special characters (such as underscores and periods).

assetName.label: Asset Name
assetName.description: Asset name, used to identify the human-readable name of the asset.

assetTag.label: Asset Tag
assetTag.description: Asset tags, used to identify service identification labels assigned to assets after port scanning. The field type is a string array, and each tag should be a non-empty string.

unitId.label: Unit ID
unitId.description: Unique identifier of the asset's owning organization.

unitName.label: Unit Name
unitName.description: Unit name, indicating the name of the unit to which the asset belongs.

unitType.label: Unit Type
unitType.description: The unit type indicates the industry and nature classification of the organization entity to which the asset belongs, used for asset ownership management, security policy formulation, and compliance auditing. This field is of enumeration type, and its value must be one of the predefined optional strings, such as: party_committee (Party committee organ), large_state_owned_enterprise (Large state-owned enterprise), company (Enterprise), public_institution (Public institution), individual (Individual), and other optional values.

party_committee.label: Party Committee
party_committee.description: The working bodies of the Communist Party of China committees at all levels are political leadership organs.

large_state_owned_enterprise.label: Large State Owned Enterprise
large_state_owned_enterprise.description: Large state-owned sole proprietorship or holding enterprises supervised by the State-owned Assets Supervision and Administration Commission of the State Council or local governments.

company.label: Company
company.description: Legal entities or unincorporated organizations engaged in commercial activities for profit-making purposes, including private enterprises, foreign-invested enterprises, etc.

public_institution.label: Public Institution
public_institution.description: A social service organization established by national administrative authorities, engaged in activities such as education, science and technology, culture, and health, possessing legal person status.

individual.label: Individual
individual.description: An individual acting as an asset owner or user, not affiliated with any organization.

government.label: Government
government.description: Administrative agencies at all levels of the state, including ministries and commissions under the State Council, local governments, and their constituent departments, exercise administrative management functions.

private_non_enterprise.label: Private Non Enterprise
private_non_enterprise.description: Social organizations established by enterprises, institutions, social groups, other social forces, or individual citizens using non-state-owned assets, engaged in non-profit social service activities.

social_organization.label: Social Organization
social_organization.description: A non-profit social organization voluntarily formed by Chinese citizens to achieve the common goals of its members and carry out activities in accordance with its charter, which must be registered with the civil affairs department.

law_firm.label: Law Firm
law_firm.description: Legally established institutions that provide legal services to clients, primarily including law firms.

mass_organization.label: Mass Organization
mass_organization.description: A general term for people's organizations and mass organizations, which are specific social group organizations under the leadership of the Communist Party of China, such as trade unions, the Communist Youth League, and the Women's Federation.

foundation.label: Foundation
foundation.description: A non-profit legal entity established with assets donated by natural persons, legal persons, or other organizations for the purpose of engaging in public welfare activities.

religious_group.label: Religious Group
religious_group.description: A voluntary association formed by religious citizens in accordance with the law, aimed at uniting religious citizens and conducting religious activities.

defense_agency.label: Defense Agency
defense_agency.description: Agencies responsible for national defense and armed forces development, such as departments and subordinate units of the Central Military Commission.

forensic_institution.label: Forensic Institution
forensic_institution.description: A legal entity or other organization that has obtained the 'Judicial Appraisal License' after review and registration by judicial administrative authorities, and provides judicial appraisal services in litigation activities.

medical_institution.label: Medical Institution
medical_institution.description: Legally established institutions engaged in disease diagnosis and treatment activities, including hospitals, clinics, and health centers.

overseas_institution.label: Overseas Institution
overseas_institution.description: Legally registered or established institutional entities outside Mainland China (including Hong Kong, Macau, Taiwan, and foreign countries).

foreign_cultural_center.label: Foreign Cultural Center
foreign_cultural_center.description: Non-profit organizations established by foreign governments within China, aimed at promoting cultural exchange and cooperation between the two countries.

notary_organization.label: Notary Organization
notary_organization.description: A notarization institution legally established, non-profit oriented, independently exercising notarial functions and assuming civil liabilities in accordance with the law.

impartial_organization.label: Impartial Organization
impartial_organization.description: Generally refers to third-party organizations engaged in independent, objective evaluation, certification, arbitration, and similar activities.

collective_economy.label: Collective Economy
collective_economy.description: A form of public ownership economy where the means of production are jointly owned by a portion of the laborers, such as rural collective economic organizations and urban collective enterprises.

commission_bureau.label: Commission Bureau
commission_bureau.description: A collective term for committees, offices, and bureaus in local governments, which are administrative departments responsible for specific executive management functions.

district_county.label: District County
district_county.description: A general term for municipal districts or counties as primary administrative divisions and administrative levels, possessing complete governmental functions.

other.label: Other
other.description: Other types of organizations not belonging to the above categories.

industry.label: Industry Classification
industry.description: The national economic industry classification to which the asset belongs, used to identify the business nature, regulatory environment, and security requirements of the asset's domain.

education.label: Education
education.description: The industry engaged in various levels and types of education, training, and related support services.

government.label: Government
government.description: State authorities at all levels, administrative organs, judicial organs, and other institutions that perform public management and service functions.

medical.label: Medical
medical.description: Industry engaged in disease diagnosis, treatment, prevention, rehabilitation, and public health services.

postal.label: Postal Code
postal.description: The industry engaged in mail delivery services such as letters and parcels, as well as postal finance, express delivery, and logistics services.

finance.label: Finance
finance.description: The general term for industries engaged in capital financing, credit activities, and related financial services, including banking, securities, insurance, etc.

transportation.label: Transportation
transportation.description: Industries engaged in passenger and cargo transportation, warehousing, and transportation support services.

energy.label: Energy
energy.description: Industries engaged in the extraction, production, and supply of energy resources such as coal, petroleum, natural gas, electricity, and new energy.

broadcasting.label: Broadcasting
broadcasting.description: Industry engaged in the production, broadcasting, transmission of radio and television programs, as well as related online audiovisual services.

telecommunications.label: Telecommunications
telecommunications.description: The industry engaged in the operation of fixed and mobile communication networks, as well as internet access and information transmission services.

water_conservancy.label: Water Conservancy
water_conservancy.description: The industry engaged in the construction and management of water conservancy projects such as flood control, irrigation, water supply, hydropower generation, and soil and water conservation.

commercial_internet.label: Commercial Internet
commercial_internet.description: Refers to for-profit enterprises that provide internet information services to the general public.

railway.label: Railway
railway.description: Industry engaged in the operation, construction, and management of national railways, local railways, and urban rail transit systems.

banking.label: Banking
banking.description: Financial intermediary engaged in deposit-taking, loan issuance, settlement services, and other related operations.

customs.label: Customs
customs.description: A national administrative authority responsible for supervising, taxing, and combating smuggling of inbound and outbound goods, articles, and means of transport.

taxation.label: Taxation
taxation.description: The state administrative authority responsible for tax collection, management, and inspection.

civil_aviation.label: Civil Aviation
civil_aviation.description: Industries engaged in civil aviation transportation, airport services, air traffic control, and aviation support.

electric_power.label: Electric Power Sector
electric_power.description: The industry engaged in electricity production (generation), transmission (transmission and distribution), and supply.

securities.label: Securities Industry
securities.description: Financial industry engaged in securities issuance, trading, investment consulting, asset management, and other related businesses.

insurance.label: Insurance
insurance.description: A financial industry engaged in various insurance business operations, which pools funds through contractual arrangements and provides risk protection.

defense_technology.label: Defense Technology
defense_technology.description: Engaged in scientific research, production, and related supporting services for weaponry and equipment, serving as a strategic industry for national defense construction.

public_security.label: Public Security
public_security.description: Administrative authorities responsible for maintaining national security and social order, as well as combating criminal activities.

social_security.label: Social Security
social_security.description: An administrative authority responsible for human resource management, employment services, labor relations coordination, and social insurance administration.

public_finance.label: Public Finance
public_finance.description: Administrative authority responsible for macroeconomic management including government revenue and expenditure, fiscal and taxation policies, and state-owned assets management.

audit.label: Audit
audit.description: An administrative authority that independently supervises the authenticity, legality, and effectiveness of fiscal and financial revenues and expenditures of government agencies and enterprises/institutions in accordance with the law.

commerce_trade.label: Commerce Trade
commerce_trade.description: Industry engaged in wholesale, retail, import and export trade of goods and related services.

land_resources.label: Land Resources
land_resources.description: Administrative authority responsible for the planning, management, protection, and rational utilization of natural resources such as land, minerals, and oceans.

statistics.label: Statistics
statistics.description: The administrative authority responsible for organizing and implementing statistical surveys, analysis, and publication of national economic and social development data.

culture.label: Culture
culture.description: Engaged in cultural undertakings and industries such as news publishing, radio, film and television, cultural arts, and cultural heritage preservation.

agriculture.label: Agriculture
agriculture.description: Industries engaged in agricultural production and related services, including crop farming, forestry, animal husbandry, and fisheries.

diplomacy.label: Diplomacy
diplomacy.description: The administrative body responsible for handling the nation's foreign relations, safeguarding national sovereignty and interests, and conducting international exchanges and cooperation.

development_reform.label: Development Reform
development_reform.description: A macro-control department responsible for formulating and implementing national economic and social development strategies and plans, as well as advancing economic system reforms.

science_technology.label: Science Technology
science_technology.description: Engaged in the fields of scientific research, technological development, achievement transformation, and high-tech industrialization.

publicity.label: Publicity
publicity.description: Functional areas responsible for ideology, press and publication, ideological and moral construction, and spiritual civilization development.

quality_supervision.label: Quality Supervision
quality_supervision.description: Administrative authority responsible for product quality, metrology, standardization, certification, accreditation, and supervision of import-export inspection and quarantine.

construction.label: Construction
construction.description: Industries engaged in engineering activities such as housing construction, civil engineering, building installation, and decoration.

judiciary.label: Judiciary
judiciary.description: Administrative authority responsible for judicial administration, including prison management, lawyer notarization, legal aid, and legal awareness campaigns.

social_insurance.label: Social Insurance
social_insurance.description: An agency responsible for the administration and management of social insurance programs, including pension insurance, medical insurance, unemployment insurance, work-related injury insurance, and maternity insurance.

public_utilities.label: Public Utilities
public_utilities.description: Industries that provide basic and public welfare services to society, such as tap water, gas, heating, and public transportation.

environmental_protection.label: Environmental Protection
environmental_protection.description: Administrative authority responsible for environmental pollution prevention and control, ecological protection, environmental monitoring and law enforcement, as well as other environmental protection management functions.

information_services.label: Information Services
information_services.description: An industry engaged in information technology consulting, software development, data processing, system integration, and internet platform services.

industry_commerce.label: Industry Commerce
industry_commerce.description: Administrative authority responsible for market entity registration, market supervision, anti-monopoly, consumer rights protection, and other market regulation and supervision functions.

other.label: Other
other.description: Other industries or fields not included in the above categories.

assetAlias.label: Asset Alias
assetAlias.description: Asset alias, used for custom naming of assets to facilitate viewing and identification.

assetSource.label: Asset Source
assetSource.description: Asset source, indicating the acquisition method of the asset, such as the IP address of the device that discovered the asset or the name of the operator who manually entered it.

orgId.label: Organization ID
orgId.description: This field represents the organizational structure identifier to which the asset belongs. It is formatted as a string type, typically automatically generated or assigned by the system, and serves as a unique identifier for the organizational structure.

orgName.label: Organization Name
orgName.description: The name of the organizational structure to which the asset belongs. It should be of string type, representing the full name of the organizational structure.

assetUser.label: Asset User
assetUser.description: Name of the personnel using the asset, in string format.

updateTime.label: Update Time
updateTime.description: Timestamp of the last update for the data information, using standard time format in the pattern: yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm:ss.

assetGroup.label: Asset Group
assetGroup.description: This field indicates the organizational group or department name to which the asset belongs.

assetGeoRegion.label: Asset Geographic Region
assetGeoRegion.description: This field indicates the actual physical geographic location region of the asset, used to record the specific geographic location information of the asset. The format is of string type, using a standard geographic location description format, such as a hierarchical structure of 'Province/City/District' or 'Country/Province/City'.

assetGeoAddress.label: Asset Geographic Address
assetGeoAddress.description: The detailed physical location of the asset, including street address, building, floor, and room number information.

isDomestic.label: Is Domestic
isDomestic.description: This field is used to identify whether the asset is domestically produced or procured within the country.

unitRole.label: Unit Role
unitRole.description: Functional role classification of the asset's affiliated organization.

regulatory_unit.label: Regulatory Unit
regulatory_unit.description: Superior or supervisory authority within the management system that assumes primary regulatory, guidance, or approval responsibilities.

collaborative_unit.label: Collaborative Unit
collaborative_unit.description: Relevant units that closely collaborate with the supervisory authority in specific transactions or projects, undertaking responsibilities for coordinated execution or joint management.

key_unit.label: Key Unit
key_unit.description: Core units that require prioritized management and protection due to factors such as business criticality, system importance, or elevated security risks.

general_unit.label: General Unit
general_unit.description: General entities within the management system that comply with routine management requirements and assume standard security responsibilities and obligations.

scriptContent.label: Script Content
scriptContent.description: The actual content of the script file, including executable code or commands. The content is in string format and should contain valid script language syntax or system commands.

assetDepartmentName.label: Asset Department Name
assetDepartmentName.description: Management department (unit) name, referring to the full name of the department or unit responsible for managing the asset.

otherInfo.label: Other Information
otherInfo.description: This field is used to record additional supplementary information related to assets or events.

assetDescription.label: Asset Description
assetDescription.description: Asset description provides detailed information about the asset, including but not limited to asset type, primary purpose, affiliated department, user, and other relevant information. This field is of string type, and the content should be concise and accurately reflect the characteristics and status of the asset.

assetGeoCountry.label: Asset Geographic Country
assetGeoCountry.description: The name of the country where the asset is currently located, using the country names from the ISO 3166-1 standard (e.g., China, United States). The value should be the full and standard country name, avoiding abbreviations or codes.

assetGeoProvince.label: Asset Geographic Province
assetGeoProvince.description: The name of the province where the asset is currently located, which should comply with the national administrative division naming standards.

assetGeoCountyCode.label: Asset Geographic County Code
assetGeoCountyCode.description: Administrative division code of the asset's physical location (county/district), compliant with the national administrative division coding standard.

assetGeoCounty.label: Asset Geographic County
assetGeoCounty.description: The full name of the district or county where the asset is physically located. Standard administrative division names should be used, avoiding abbreviations or colloquial terms.

newFilename.label: New Filename
newFilename.description: The new filename refers to the name of the file after a rename operation, including the complete file path information. This field is of string type and should adhere to the file path format specifications of the operating system. It typically includes the directory path and filename, such as a Unix/Linux-style path starting with a forward slash (/) or a Windows-style path containing a drive letter and backslashes (\).

userWorkstations.label: User Workstations
userWorkstations.description: A comma-separated list of NetBIOS or DNS names of computers from which the user can log on. Format requirements: Multiple computer names should be separated by English commas, and each name should be a valid NetBIOS name or DNS hostname.

fileDescription.label: File Description
fileDescription.description: The file description field is used to record functional or purpose information about a file or process.

fileVersion.label: File Version
fileVersion.description: File version number, typically used to identify software updates or patch versions. The format usually consists of a sequence of numbers separated by dots, such as 'major version.minor version.revision.build number'.

destInfo.label: Destination Information
destInfo.description: Target information refers to the specific identifier of the computer or service being attempted to log in to, such as hostname, IP address, or service name. Format requirements: Typically in string format, which can be a valid domain name, IPv4 address, IPv6 address, or hostname.

destLoginGuid.label: Destination Login GUID
destLoginGuid.description: Unique identifier for a specific login session or login request on the target system, typically in GUID (Globally Unique Identifier) format.

destServiceName.label: Destination Service Name
destServiceName.description: This field indicates the name of the target service being accessed or referenced, such as a hostname, database instance name, or application service identifier.

resourceUri.label: Resource URI
resourceUri.description: The resource URI field is used to identify the Uniform Resource Identifier of a specific resource. Its value should conform to the URI standard format specification, typically starting with a protocol type (e.g., http, https, ftp) followed by the resource path.

assetCategory.label: Asset Category
assetCategory.description: Asset classification refers to the categorization of assets from an asset management perspective. This field is an enumeration type with predefined optional values including: database, data_table, data_field, account, api, etc.

database.label: Database
database.description: Structured data storage systems, such as relational databases like MySQL and Oracle, or non-relational databases like MongoDB.

data_table.label: Data Table
data_table.description: The core storage unit in a database, used for storing collections of data records with the same structure.

data_field.label: Data Field
data_field.description: The smallest data unit in a data table or data structure, used to store attribute values of specific types.

account.label: Account
account.description: Digital identity credentials used to access systems, applications, or services, including user accounts, service accounts, etc.

api.label: API
api.description: Application Programming Interface (API), providing a standardized way for software components to interact and exchange data.

file.label: File
file.description: A collection of data stored in the file system, which may include documents, executable programs, configuration files, or multimedia content.

website.label: Website
website.description: A collection of web pages and applications accessible via HTTP/HTTPS protocols, representing common external services and attack surfaces.

mobile_app.label: Mobile Application
mobile_app.description: Mobile device application, typically referring to client-side software running on mobile operating systems such as iOS or Android.

official_account.label: Official Account
official_account.description: Official accounts operated on social media platforms such as WeChat, used for publishing information, providing services, and interacting with users.

mini_program.label: Mini Program
mini_program.description: Lightweight applications that can be used within super apps (such as WeChat, Alipay) without the need for download or installation.

terminal.label: Terminal
terminal.description: Endpoints of computing devices directly operated by users, including personal computers, ATMs, information terminals, etc.

device.label: Device
device.description: Generalized hardware devices, including physical entities such as network devices, IoT devices, office equipment, etc.

server.label: Server
server.description: Physical computing equipment deployed in on-premises data centers, used to provide network services or run enterprise applications.

virtual_machine.label: Virtual Machine
virtual_machine.description: A complete, independent computer system environment simulated on a physical server through virtualization technology.

container.label: Container
container.description: Operating system-level virtualization technology used for packaging, distributing, and running applications along with their dependencies.

system_software.label: System Software
system_software.description: Software that provides fundamental services for computer operations, such as operating systems, database management systems, middleware, etc.

application_software.label: Application Software
application_software.description: Software designed for specific purposes or to address particular problems, such as office software, ERP, and CRM systems.

domain.label: Domain Name
domain.description: An address identifier on the internet, used to locate websites and services, serving as a critical entry point for network assets.

ip_address.label: IP Address
ip_address.description: Internet Protocol address, used to uniquely identify and locate a device or interface in a network.

port.label: Port
port.description: A logical endpoint in network communication, used in conjunction with an IP address to distinguish between different services on the same device.

certificate.label: Certificate
certificate.description: Digital certificate, an electronic credential used for identity authentication, data encryption, and secure communication.

cloud_server.label: Cloud Server
cloud_server.description: Elastic computing instances provided by cloud service providers (such as AWS EC2, Alibaba Cloud ECS) and managed as a service.

cloud_storage.label: Cloud Storage
cloud_storage.description: Object, block, or file storage services provided by cloud service providers, such as AWS S3 and Alibaba Cloud OSS.

other.label: Other
other.description: Other types of assets not included in the above categories.

assetGeoLatitude.label: Asset Geographic Latitude
assetGeoLatitude.description: Latitude coordinate of the asset location, expressed in decimal degrees according to the WGS84 geodetic coordinate system standard. The format requires a floating-point string representing degrees of north or south latitude, with a valid range from -90.000000 to 90.000000.

assetGeoLongitude.label: Asset Geographic Longitude
assetGeoLongitude.description: Longitude coordinate of the asset location, expressed in decimal degrees and compliant with the WGS84 geodetic coordinate system standard. The format requires a string type, representing a floating-point number within the range of -180.000000 to 180.000000.

assetUserPhone.label: Asset User Phone Number
assetUserPhone.description: Contact mobile number of the asset user, used for security communication. Must comply with mobile number format specifications.

securityZone.label: Security Zone
securityZone.description: This field represents the logical or physical network segment assigned for security purposes.

productVendorName.label: Product Vendor Name
productVendorName.description: The product vendor name field is used to identify the official full name of the security product vendor. The format is a string with no specific character set restrictions, but the standard name used by the vendor in business registration or official promotions should be adopted to ensure consistency and accuracy.

deviceSendProductName.label: Device Product Name
deviceSendProductName.description: The device product name is used to identify the official standard name of the software or hardware product that generates logs. It is a string format and requires the use of clear, standardized official product names.

deviceAssetSubTypeId.label: Device Asset Subtype ID
deviceAssetSubTypeId.description: The device subtype ID is a unique numeric identifier for the sub-classification of device types, used to identify specific device subtypes. This field is of enumeration type, and its value should fall within the system-defined enumeration range.

2.label: Nix
2.description: Unix-like operating systems, including Linux and BSD variants

3.label: Router
3.description: Network routing device used for forwarding data packets between networks.

4.label: Switch
4.description: Network switching device, used to connect devices within a local area network and forward data frames.

5.label: VPN
5.description: Virtual Private Network (VPN) device, providing secure remote access and site-to-site connectivity.

6.label: Load Balancing
6.description: Load balancing device, used for distributing network traffic to improve performance and reliability.

7.label: Firewall
7.description: A network security device used to control inbound and outbound network traffic based on security rules.

8.label: Network Gate
8.description: Network isolation device used for secure data exchange between networks with different security levels.

9.label: Intrusion Detection System
9.description: Intrusion Detection System (IDS), used to monitor network or system activities for detecting malicious behaviors.

10.label: Intrusion Prevention System
10.description: The Intrusion Prevention System (IPS) actively blocks malicious traffic upon detecting threats.

11.label: Unified Threat Management
11.description: Unified Threat Management (UTM) device, integrating multiple security functions such as firewall, antivirus, and intrusion prevention.

12.label: Next Generation Firewall
12.description: Next-generation firewall, providing application layer inspection, deep packet inspection, and advanced threat protection.

13.label: Web Application Firewall
13.description: Web Application Firewall, specifically designed to protect web applications from attacks such as SQL injection and XSS.

14.label: Traffic Monitoring Device
14.description: Network traffic monitoring device, used for real-time analysis and monitoring of network traffic patterns.

15.description: Web page tamper-proof system, designed to protect website content from unauthorized modifications.

16.label: DDoS Mitigation System
16.description: Anti-Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) protection system, mitigating DDoS attacks to safeguard service availability.

17.label: Antivirus System
17.description: Antivirus system, which detects and removes malware, viruses, and trojans.

18.label: Counterintelligence System
18.description: Anti-spyware system designed to prevent spyware from stealing sensitive information and monitoring user activities.

19.label: Data Leakage Prevention System
19.description: Data Leakage Prevention (DLP) system, designed to monitor and prevent sensitive data from being leaked through various channels.

20.label: Email Audit System
20.description: Email auditing system, monitoring and auditing email content to comply with security policies and regulatory requirements.

21.label: Identity Management System
21.description: Identity and Access Management system, managing user authentication, authorization, and permissions.

22.label: Traffic Scrubbing System
22.description: Traffic scrubbing system, filtering malicious traffic to protect network resources and ensure business continuity.

23.label: Database Audit System
23.description: Database auditing system that monitors and records database access, operations, and permission changes.

24.label: Web Audit System
24.description: Web auditing system, auditing access, operations, and security events of web applications.

25.label: Operational Audit System
25.description: Operation and maintenance auditing system, which monitors and records system operation and maintenance activities to prevent unauthorized access.

26.label: Internet Behavior Audit System
26.description: Internet behavior auditing system, which monitors and audits employees' network usage to ensure compliance with security policies.

27.label: Unified Audit Gateway
27.description: Unified Audit Gateway, which centrally collects, normalizes, and analyzes various types of audit logs.

28.label: Log Audit System
28.description: The log auditing system collects, stores, analyzes, and alerts on system security logs.

29.label: Security Management System
29.description: Security management system that integrates security management functions such as policy management, risk management, and incident response.

30.label: Honeypot System
30.description: Honeypot system, designed to deceive attackers for the purpose of collecting attack information and analyzing attack techniques.

31.label: Application Scanner
31.description: Application vulnerability scanner, designed to detect security vulnerabilities in web applications and mobile applications.

32.label: Network Scanner
32.description: Network vulnerability scanner, which scans network devices, services, and ports to identify security vulnerabilities.

33.label: Host Scanner
33.description: Host vulnerability scanner, scanning for operating system and application vulnerabilities as well as configuration issues.

34.label: Web Server
34.description: Web server software, such as IIS, Apache, Nginx, etc., used for hosting websites and applications.

35.description: Database server software, such as MySQL, Oracle, SQL Server, etc., stores and manages data.

36.description: Mail server software, such as Exchange, Postfix, etc., handles the sending and receiving of emails.

37.label: Storage Server
37.description: Storage server, providing data storage, backup, and sharing services.

38.label: FTP Server
38.description: FTP server, providing File Transfer Protocol services, supporting file upload and download.

39.label: Application Server
39.description: Application server, which runs enterprise applications and business logic, such as Java EE and .NET applications.

43.label: Windows Audit Agent
43.description: Windows System Audit Agent, collects Windows event logs and system activities.

44.label: Nix Audit Agent
44.description: Unix-like system audit agent that collects Linux/Unix system logs and audit data

45.label: WMI Audit Agent
45.description: Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) auditing agent, which collects system information and events through WMI.

51.label: Collector
51.description: Log collector, which gathers and forwards log data from various data sources.

52.label: Communication Server
52.description: Communication server, responsible for network communication, message delivery, and protocol conversion.

53.label: Correlation Engine
53.description: Security event correlation engine, which analyzes log data to detect complex security incidents.

56.label: Endpoint Detection and Response System
56.description: Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) system, which monitors host activities, detects threats, and responds to security incidents.

57.label: Virtualization Device
57.description: Virtualization platform devices, such as VMware ESXi and Hyper-V, which run virtual machines.

58.label: Network Printer
58.description: Network-connected printer device supporting network printing functionality.

59.label: APT
59.description: Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) detection system, designed for monitoring and protecting against APT attacks.

60.label: DNS Server
60.description: Domain Name System server, providing domain name resolution services and DNS security protection.

61.label: API Risk Monitoring System
61.description: API risk monitoring system, which monitors security risks and usage anomalies of API interfaces.

62.label: API Security Gateway
62.description: API security gateway that protects API interfaces from attacks, providing authentication, authorization, and rate limiting.

63.label: Vulnerability Scanning System
63.description: Vulnerability scanning system that comprehensively scans for system, network, and application vulnerabilities.

65.label: UES
65.description: Unified Endpoint Security System, integrating endpoint protection, detection, and response capabilities.

deviceAddress.label: Device IP Address
deviceAddress.description: The IP address of the device when generating logs, used to identify the log source device. Format requirements: must be a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address format.

message.label: Message Description
message.description: Used to record detailed description information for logs or alerts, stored as text strings. The content typically includes explanations of security events, system activities, or abnormal conditions, along with context and key parameters.

catOutcome.label: Category Outcome
catOutcome.description: This field is used to indicate the final result status of an event operation or attack. Its value is a predefined enumeration type, with current main options including: OK (indicating successful operation), FAIL (indicating failed operation), and Attempt (indicating an attempted operation). The value must be strictly limited to the enumeration range defined by the system.

OK.label: Success
OK.description: It is reasonable to infer that the event has been successfully executed.

FAIL.label: Failure
FAIL.description: It is reasonable to infer that the event has failed.

Attempt.label: Attempt
Attempt.description: The event has occurred, but its success or failure cannot be determined.

XFF.label: X-Forwarded-For Header
XFF.description: The XFF header field is used to identify the original IP address of the client connecting to the web server through an HTTP proxy or load balancer.

srcMacAddress.label: Source MAC Address
srcMacAddress.description: The source MAC address represents the media access control address of the sender in a network data frame. Format requirements: Must be in standard MAC address format, consisting of 6 groups of hexadecimal bytes separated by colons (xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx), with each group containing two characters and ranging from 00 to FF.

destMacAddress.label: Destination MAC Address
destMacAddress.description: The destination MAC address represents the media access control address of the recipient in a network data frame. Format requirements: Must be in standard MAC address format, consisting of 6 groups of hexadecimal bytes separated by colons (xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx), with each group containing two characters and ranging from 00 to FF.

ruleType.label: Rule Type
ruleType.description: The rule type identifies the security detection rule type corresponding to alerts generated by security devices (such as firewalls, IDS, IPS, EDR, etc.), reflecting the classification of specific attack patterns or anomalous behaviors in the device's built-in rule library. This field is an enumeration type, and its value is a hierarchical path string representing threat categories, typically formatted as '/primary classification/secondary classification'.

/WebAttack/XXE.label: Web Attack XML External Entity Injection
/WebAttack/XXE.description: XXE (XML External Entity) injection attack initiated from the external network. When external entity references are permitted, constructing malicious content can lead to arbitrary file reading, system command execution, internal network port scanning, and attacks on internal web services.

/WebAttack/XSS.label: Web Attack Cross Site Scripting
/WebAttack/XSS.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) attack initiated from the external network. By exploiting vulnerabilities left during web development, malicious JavaScript code is injected into web pages to attack browsers of normal users accessing the site.

/WebAttack/WebshellRequest.label: Web Attack Webshell Request
/WebAttack/WebshellRequest.description: External attackers attempt to access webshells for command control, file viewing, and other operations. Note the distinction from malicious programs/webshell backdoors; this primarily includes webshell request attempts and webshell page scanning. Confirmed webshell communications (e.g., server responses to webshell commands, server returns webshell one-liners or webshell trojan characteristics) should be classified under the malicious program category.

/WebAttack/WebTempering.label: Web Attack Web Tampering
/WebAttack/WebTempering.description: External attackers exploit vulnerabilities or implanted webshells to attempt tampering with legitimate web pages by injecting phishing links, prohibited content, hidden links, fraudulent materials, etc.

/WebAttack/SSRF.label: Web Attack SSRF
/WebAttack/SSRF.description: Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) attack initiated from the external network. The attacker forges server requests to send data to internal network hosts that communicate with it, typically used to probe or attack internal services from the external network.

/WebAttack/SQLInjection.label: Web Attack SQL Injection
/WebAttack/SQLInjection.description: SQL injection attacks initiated from external networks targeting web applications or web frameworks.

/WebAttack/RFI.label: Web Attack Remote File Inclusion
/WebAttack/RFI.description: An externally initiated attack exploits the dynamic file inclusion mechanism implemented in the target application. By manipulating submitted parameters to control the application runtime to reference a malicious file path on a remote server, it may achieve remote code execution, webshell implantation, and other malicious functions.

/WebAttack/LFI.label: Web Attack Local File Inclusion
/WebAttack/LFI.description: An external network-initiated attack exploits the dynamic file inclusion mechanism implemented in the target application. By manipulating parameters submitted to control the application's runtime path to local sensitive files, it may achieve functions such as sensitive file disclosure, tampering, or writing webshells.

/WebAttack/FileUpload.label: Web Attack File Upload
/WebAttack/FileUpload.description: An attack behavior initiated from the external network that exploits the file upload functionality by bypassing or insufficiently validating user input, resulting in the direct upload of malicious files.

/WebAttack/DirTraversal.label: Web Attack Directory Traversal
/WebAttack/DirTraversal.description: A security vulnerability caused by misconfigured web servers or insufficient security validation of user-input file names in web applications. This allows external attackers to bypass server security restrictions by leveraging special characters, enabling them to attempt access to arbitrary files (including those outside the web root directory), read sensitive files, or even execute system commands.

/WebAttack/CommandExec.label: Web Attack Command Execution
/WebAttack/CommandExec.description: An attack initiated from the external network that exploits a web application with system command execution functionality. The attack achieves arbitrary system command execution on the server through techniques such as command concatenation and blacklist bypass.

/WebAttack/CodeInjection.label: Web Attack Code Injection
/WebAttack/CodeInjection.description: An attack behavior initiated from the external network that exploits vulnerabilities in middleware, frameworks, or web components to inject carefully crafted executable code (such as Java, PHP, etc.), enabling remote command execution on the server.

/WebAttack/CSRF.label: Web Attack CSRF
/WebAttack/CSRF.description: Cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attack initiated from the external network, which exploits legitimate users' cookies to forge identity requests for accessing websites.

/WebAttack/CRLF.label: Web Attack CRLF Injection
/WebAttack/CRLF.description: HTTP CRLF injection attack initiated from the external network. The HTTP protocol uses CRLF symbols (carriage return and line feed) for separation. Attackers inject malicious line breaks in requests to bypass website security checks.

/SuspTraffic/Tunnel.label: Suspicious Traffic Tunnel
/SuspTraffic/Tunnel.description: An intranet host sends or receives tunneled communication packets. The tunneling protocol encapsulates data frames or packets from other protocols within new packet headers for transmission, which are then decapsulated at the destination and forwarded to the actual target. Examples include HTTP tunnels, DNS tunnels, and VPNs. For instance: 1. Detect tunnel communication traffic characteristics, such as DNS tunneling. 2. Identify common tunneling tool signatures, including proxy tunnels/covert tunnels. Intranet <-> Extranet, source address may vary.

/SuspTraffic/SuspContent.label: Suspicious Content
/SuspTraffic/SuspContent.description: Internal network hosts request malicious services (such as drive-by downloads, spoofing, fraud), or the content of sent/received packets contains suspicious elements like phishing attempts or sensitive information.

/SuspTraffic/RemoteCtrl.label: Suspicious Traffic Remote Control
/SuspTraffic/RemoteCtrl.description: Internal network hosts communicating with C2 servers, detecting remote control characteristics and suspicious responses in the traffic, such as: 1. Internal network sending command-line banner information (e.g., cmd/powershell) to external networks. 2. Internal network transmitting echo information after executing common commands to external networks. 3. Detecting communication signatures of specific remote control tools. Common remote control uses reverse connections (internal -> external networks), while bind connections (external -> internal networks) also exist, with victims being internal hosts.

/SuspTraffic/MaliciousIP.label: Malicious IP Address
/SuspTraffic/MaliciousIP.description: Internal network hosts communicating with malicious IPs. Malicious IPs include mining pool IPs, black industry IPs, etc.

/SuspTraffic/MaliciousCert.label: Suspicious Traffic Malicious Certificate
/SuspTraffic/MaliciousCert.description: Internal network hosts installing malicious certificates or accessing URLs with malicious certificates. For example: 1. Detecting access to malicious HTTPS websites through SSL/TLS certificate information. 2. Detecting suspicious domains through the SNI information of certificates. Internal network -> External network.

/SuspTraffic/Others.label: Suspicious Traffic Others
/SuspTraffic/Others.description: Suspicious communications initiated by internal network hosts. Includes: suspicious session connections, abnormal protocol packets, and communication behaviors with suspicious ports such as 4444/2745.

/SuspEndpoint/SuspThread.label: Suspicious Thread
/SuspEndpoint/SuspThread.description: Behaviors such as remote thread injection on internal network hosts.

/SuspEndpoint/SuspRegistry.label: Suspicious Registry
/SuspEndpoint/SuspRegistry.description: Detect suspicious operations such as additions, modifications, or deletions to the registry on intranet hosts.

/SuspEndpoint/SuspProcessAccess.label: Suspicious Endpoint Process Access
/SuspEndpoint/SuspProcessAccess.description: When a process opens another process, the process access event is reported. This operation typically involves information queries or read/write operations on the target process's address space. This can detect hacking tools that read memory contents of processes such as Local Security Authority Subsystem Service (Lsass.exe) to steal credentials for pass-the-hash attacks.

/SuspEndpoint/SuspProcess.label: Suspicious Process
/SuspEndpoint/SuspProcess.description: Suspicious process behavior detected on an internal network host, including: 1. Abnormal process names, abnormal process creation relationships, abnormal process command-line parameters, etc. 2. Other abnormal process behaviors, such as permission anomalies, state anomalies, abnormal startup methods or frequencies, etc.

/SuspEndpoint/SuspPipeEvents.label: Suspicious Endpoint Suspicious Pipe Events
/SuspEndpoint/SuspPipeEvents.description: Generated when creating a named pipe, which is commonly used by malware for inter-process communication.

/SuspEndpoint/SuspOpenPort.label: Suspicious Endpoint Open Port
/SuspEndpoint/SuspOpenPort.description: Uncommon ports are open on internal network hosts.

/SuspEndpoint/SuspDriver.label: Suspicious Endpoint Suspicious Driver
/SuspEndpoint/SuspDriver.description: Internal network host loading unknown or unsigned driver files.

/SuspEndpoint/SuspConnection.label: Suspicious Connection
/SuspEndpoint/SuspConnection.description: Network connection events record TCP/UDP connections on the machine, such as attacker scanning, malicious program outbound connections, tunnel establishment, lateral movement, and reverse shell connections.

/SuspEndpoint/OpAbnormaly.label: Suspicious Endpoint Operation Anomaly
