parentProcessUserName.description: The user account name of the parent process in the operating system, used to identify the user identity that initiated the process.

parentImage.label: Parent Process Image Path
parentImage.description: This field represents the full path of the parent process executable in the file system. The value should be a string formatted according to the operating system specifications, typically an absolute path, such as a Unix/Linux path starting with a forward slash (/) or a Windows path starting with a drive letter (e.g., C:\). The path should not contain illegal characters and its length should be within the system's allowed limits. Examples: /usr/bin/bash or C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe.

commandLine.label: Command Line
commandLine.description: The process command line is the complete command line string passed when starting a process, used to record the specific commands and parameters of the executed process.

parentCommandLine.label: Parent Command Line
parentCommandLine.description: The complete command-line string passed when the parent process was launched.

startAddress.label: Start Address
startAddress.description: The starting address is the virtual memory address where a new thread begins execution, pointing to the entry point of the thread code. The format must be a hexadecimal string, typically prefixed with '0x' followed by hexadecimal digits (0-9, a-f).

startModule.label: Start Module
startModule.description: This field indicates the module name where the thread begins execution, formatted as a string type. It typically records the name of an executable file or dynamic link library, with examples such as "ntdll.dll" or "kernel32.dll".

targetFilename.label: Target Filename
targetFilename.description: The target file refers to the complete path of the file involved in system operations or file operations. Format requirements: must be a valid file path string, with path separators being forward slashes (/) or backslashes (\). Example value: /data1/uacp/shell/uacpClient.sh.

dvcAction.label: Device Action
dvcAction.description: The device action field records the automated response actions taken by security devices against detected threats or anomalous behaviors, such as blocking, allowing, quarantining, or alerting. The value should be a string describing the response action.

durationTime.label: Duration Time
durationTime.description: Duration represents the complete time length from the start to the end of an event or operation, measured in seconds. This field is a long integer value and should be greater than or equal to 0.

regValue.label: Registry Value
regValue.description: This field stores the actual configuration data contained in Windows registry key values. The value is of string type, representing the specific numerical value or configuration information of the registry entry.

imageLoaded.label: Image Loaded Path
imageLoaded.description: This field records the full file system path of dynamically linked libraries or driver modules loaded during process runtime. The format is a string and should use the operating system's standard file path format. For example, Windows systems use drive letters with backslash-separated paths (e.g., C:\Program Files\...), while Linux/Unix systems use forward-slash-separated absolute paths (e.g., /usr/lib/...). The path should not include environment variables or relative path symbols (e.g., ., .., ~).

userName.label: User Name
userName.description: User name, referring to the user's real name.

destUserName.label: Destination User Name
destUserName.description: This field represents the target principal user identity name for network connections, system access, or security events. It is of string type, and the specific content should be a valid username defined in the operating system or application.

initiated.label: Connection Initiation Type
initiated.description: Identifies whether the network connection was actively initiated or passively accepted by the local endpoint. The format must be a boolean value, accepting only true or false, where true indicates the connection was actively initiated by the local endpoint, and false indicates the connection was passively accepted by the local endpoint.

sha256.label: SHA-256 Hash Value
sha256.description: The SHA-256 cryptographic hash value of the file content, used for unique identification and file integrity verification. The format must be a 64-character hexadecimal string with character set 0-9, a-f (case insensitive).

destImage.label: Destination Process Image Path
destImage.description: The full path of the target process's executable file, used to record the path information of the target process in cross-process operations. This field is of string type and should provide the complete absolute path including the drive letter, directory, and filename, such as the executable file path format in Windows systems.

destHostName.label: Destination Host Name
destHostName.description: Target hostname (target identifier) refers to the network identifier of the destination device in a network connection or security event. It can be a DNS hostname (including FQDN), NetBIOS name, local hostname, or IP address. If the access involves a non-standard port, the port number should typically be appended after the identifier (e.g., 192.168.1.1:8080 or host.example.com:8443).

destAddress.label: Destination IP Address
destAddress.description: Destination IP address, identifying the target IP address of the network communication connection. Format requirements: must comply with IP address format specifications, supporting IPv4 (e.g., 192.168.1.1) or IPv6 (e.g., 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334) address notation.

srcTransAddress.label: Source Translated Address
srcTransAddress.description: The translated source IP address refers to the source IP address presented at the network layer after processing through Network Address Translation (NAT), proxy servers, or VPN tunnel encapsulation. This field must comply with IP address format specifications, either as a dotted-decimal notation IPv4 address (e.g., 192.168.1.1) or an RFC-compliant IPv6 address.

cve.label: CVE ID
cve.description: This field represents the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) standard vulnerability identifier, used to uniquely identify a publicly disclosed cybersecurity vulnerability. The format must strictly adhere to the "CVE-YYYY-NNNN…" pattern, where YYYY is a 4-digit year and NNNN… is the sequence number of the vulnerability within that year (the number of digits may vary). Example: CVE-2012-3152.

cost.label: Execution Time
cost.description: This field records the execution time of commands, scripts, or programs in milliseconds. The value is of long integer type (long), representing the duration from the start to the end of the operation, and must be a non-negative integer.

cmdContent.label: Command Content
cmdContent.description: Command line content refers to the specific command string executed in a computer system or terminal. The content is typically readable text encoded in ASCII or UTF-8.

clientPrg.label: Client Program
clientPrg.description: This field is used to identify the name of the client application connecting to the database or other services, typically the name of the client software or driver.

transProtocol.label: Transport Protocol
transProtocol.description: Transport layer protocol type, indicating the protocol used at the transport layer of the OSI model. Optional values include standard transport layer protocols such as TCP (Transmission Control Protocol) and UDP (User Datagram Protocol).

TCP.label: TCP
TCP.description: Connection-oriented reliable transport protocol that provides sequential packet transmission, error detection, and retransmission mechanisms.

UDP.label: UDP
UDP.description: A connectionless, unreliable transport protocol that provides low-latency data transmission, suitable for real-time applications.

tag.label: Tag
tag.description: This field is used to identify the characteristics or classification labels of the alert. Format requirements: must be a string array. Each label should be a non-empty string, typically containing text that describes the alert's characteristics or classification, such as 'port scan', 'unauthorized external connection', etc.

ccUserName.label: CC User Name
ccUserName.description: The CC (Carbon Copy) field is used to record the collection of email addresses of recipients who receive a copy of the message. This field is of string type and should contain one or more valid email addresses compliant with RFC 5322 standards. Multiple addresses are typically separated by commas.

signed.label: Signed Status
signed.description: Indicates whether the target object contains a valid digital signature certificate. This field is of Boolean type, with values of true or false representing 'yes' or 'no' respectively.

signature.label: Digital Signature
signature.description: Signature information refers to digital signatures or certificate data used to verify the integrity of files or data, formatted as a string. This field typically contains textual information such as signature algorithm identifiers, signature values, or certificate issuer and subject details.

bytesOut.label: Response Bytes Out
bytesOut.description: Response byte count, used to measure the total byte size of server response messages. This field is a long integer value that must be a non-negative integer representing the byte count.

bytesIn.label: Bytes In
bytesIn.description: This field is used to count the total number of bytes in client request messages, with its value being a non-negative long integer.

bccUserName.label: BCC User Name
bccUserName.description: This field records the collection of email addresses for BCC (Blind Carbon Copy) recipients. Multiple addresses should be separated by semicolons. Each email address must conform to the standard email address format, typically consisting of a local part, an @ symbol, and a domain part.

startFunction.label: Start Function
startFunction.description: The start function is the entry point function name where a new thread begins execution. It is of string type and only supports combinations of letters, numbers, and underscores.

callTrace.label: Call Trace
callTrace.description: The function call stack records the sequence of function calls at the moment of thread creation, including module names and memory address offsets. The format consists of multiple call frames separated by vertical bars '|'. Each call frame follows the format 'full module file path + hexadecimal memory offset'. The module path should use standard filesystem path format, and the memory offset should be a hexadecimal number without the '0x' prefix.

cvssVector.label: CVSS Vector
cvssVector.description: Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) vector string, used to describe the values of various metric dimensions of a vulnerability in a standardized format. This string must comply with the official CVSS vector format specification, typically starting with a version identifier (e.g., 'CVSS:3.0/' or 'CVSS:3.1/'), followed by a series of metric/value pairs separated by slashes (e.g., 'AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N').

cvssVersion.label: CVSS Version
cvssVersion.description: Version identifier for the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS). This field is used to distinguish between different versions of CVSS assessment standards, such as CVSSv2.0, CVSSv3.0, or CVSSv3.1. The format typically consists of the fixed string 'CVSSv' followed by the major version number and an optional minor version number (e.g., CVSSv3.1).

cncve.label: CNCVE Vulnerability Identifier
cncve.description: The CNCVE vulnerability identifier is a unique identifier issued by the China National Vulnerability Database (CNVD) to uniquely identify a vulnerability. Its format must strictly adhere to the specification 'CNCVE-YYYY-NNNNN', where 'CNCVE' is a fixed prefix followed by a hyphen '-'; 'YYYY' represents a four-digit year; followed by another hyphen '-'; and 'NNNNN' represents a five-digit serial number. The entire identifier must be in uppercase letter format.

cnvd.label: CNVD Vulnerability Identifier
cnvd.description: The CNVD vulnerability identifier is a unique identification number assigned by the China National Vulnerability Database (CNVD) to uniquely identify and track vulnerabilities. Its format consists of the fixed string 'CNVD-' followed by the year, a hyphen, and a sequence number, for example, 'CNVD-2022-10627'. This field is of string type and must strictly adhere to the format specification 'CNVD-YYYY-NNNNN', where YYYY represents the four-digit year and NNNNN is the vulnerability sequence number.

cnnvd.label: CNNVD Vulnerability Identifier
cnnvd.description: The unique vulnerability identifier issued by the China National Vulnerability Database (CNNVD). This identifier follows a specific naming format, typically prefixed with 'CNNVD-', followed by the year and month (in YYYYMM format), and ending with a three-digit serial number. Each component is separated by a hyphen '-'. The complete standard format is: CNNVD-YYYYMM-NNN, where NNN represents a three-digit sequential number starting from 001.

cvssBaseScore.label: CVSS Base Score
cvssBaseScore.description: This field represents the score value calculated by the Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) Base Metric Group, used to measure the inherent severity of a vulnerability. The value is of string type, formatted as a floating-point number with one decimal place, ranging from 0.0 to 10.0.

hostName.label: Host Name
hostName.description: The identifying name of a host in the network, typically used to recognize a specific device in a local area network (LAN) or DNS system, such as a NetBIOS name or DNS hostname. Format requirements: must be a valid string, allowing letters, numbers, hyphens (-), and dots (.), but cannot start or end with a hyphen or dot.

userAgent.label: User Agent
userAgent.description: User agent string, used to identify anonymized information of the requesting client (user agent), typically including the client's operating system, browser type, version, device type, etc. The format must comply with the HTTP standard User-Agent string.

webServerSoftware.label: Web Server Software
webServerSoftware.description: This field indicates the name of the server software running the web service, such as Nginx, Apache, etc.

passwordComplexity.label: Password Complexity
passwordComplexity.description: The complexity level of the password policy, used to define the complexity requirements that passwords must meet. The value must be one of the predefined enumeration values: Low (low complexity), Medium (medium complexity), or High (high complexity).

Low.label: Low Complexity
Low.description: Basic password requirements, typically only specifying the minimum length.

Medium.label: Medium Complexity
Medium.description: Requires mixed character types (letters + numbers) with medium length requirements.

High.label: High Complexity
High.description: Combination of uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters required for high-strength security requirements.

passwordExpirationPolicy.label: Password Expiration Policy
passwordExpirationPolicy.description: Password validity period required by the password policy, measured in days, must be a positive integer.

errorMessage.label: Error Message
errorMessage.description: This field is used to record detailed error description information returned during the operation or interaction of systems, services, or applications. It typically includes error codes, error causes, problem context, or specific error explanations.

sql.label: SQL Statement
sql.description: SQL statements are standardized query languages submitted to databases for execution, typically used for data query, insertion, update, or deletion operations. In terms of format, it must be a string that complies with SQL syntax specifications and may include letters, numbers, operators, spaces, as well as specific SQL keywords and symbols.

requestParameters.label: Request Parameters
requestParameters.description: Request parameters are the parameter contents carried in network requests, used to transmit specific data sent from the client to the server. The parameter content is typically in string format and can be a query string, form data, JSON object, or other serialized forms. The specific format depends on the request type (e.g., GET, POST) and the content type (Content-Type).

privilegeList.label: Privilege List
privilegeList.description: The permission set field is used to describe the access control permissions owned by the system or file.

minPasswordAge.label: Minimum Password Age
minPasswordAge.description: This field indicates the minimum number of days required between password changes as specified by the password modification policy. The value is a non-negative integer, measured in days.

maxPasswordAge.label: Maximum Password Age
maxPasswordAge.description: Maximum password age, indicating the maximum number of days a password remains valid as required by the password policy. After exceeding this period, the password must be changed. This field accepts integer values in days.

forceLogoff.label: Force Logoff
forceLogoff.description: This field controls whether to forcibly terminate user sessions upon login time expiration. It accepts boolean values only, with `true` indicating enabled forced logout and `false` indicating disabled.

lockoutObservationWindow.label: Lockout Observation Window
lockoutObservationWindow.description: The lockout observation window is the time range during which the system monitors and records failed login attempts. This field is a long integer value in minutes, representing a continuous duration, and must be a positive integer greater than 0.

dbVersion.label: Database Version
dbVersion.description: Version number of the Database Management System (DBMS), typically composed of major version number, minor version number, and other numerical values separated by dots. The format varies depending on the specific database product, such as '15.1' or '5.7.38'.

confPath.label: Configuration File Path
confPath.description: Configuration file path, indicating the complete storage path of the configuration file for the application or system service in the system. This path should be an absolute path, using POSIX standard path format, such as Unix/Linux paths starting with '/' or Windows paths starting with a drive letter.

dataPath.label: Data Path
dataPath.description: The data path refers to the storage path of database or application data files. It is formatted as a string and should represent a valid filesystem path, supporting both absolute and relative path notations. The path string typically consists of directory names and filenames, using forward slashes (/) or backslashes (\) as separators.

errPath.label: Error Log Path
errPath.description: This field indicates the storage path of the application error log file, used to specify the location for storing error logs. The path format should comply with the operating system's file path specifications.

executablePath.label: Executable Path
executablePath.description: The complete storage path of the executable file in the file system, which must be a valid file system path string. It is typically represented as an absolute path, such as the path format in Unix/Linux systems.

logPath.label: Log Path
logPath.description: The storage path of the log file in the file system, used to locate the log files of applications or system services. The path format should comply with the file path specifications of the operating system. For example, Unix/Linux systems use forward slashes (/) as directory separators, and paths typically start with the root directory (/) or the current user directory (~).

pluginPath.label: Plugin Path
pluginPath.description: The plugin path field indicates the installation path of the application plugin module, with its value being a string, typically an absolute path in the operating system's file system. In terms of format, it should comply with the operating system's file path specifications, such as starting with a forward slash (/) in Unix/Linux systems, or containing drive letters and backslashes (\) in Windows systems.

sensitiveFile.label: Sensitive File
sensitiveFile.description: This field indicates whether the file contains sensitive data, such as passwords, keys, personal information, etc. It is of boolean type and only allows the values `true` or `false`.

isCrossBorder.label: Is Cross Border
isCrossBorder.description: Indicates whether the file or data involves cross-border transmission. The field type is boolean, with values of true or false, representing 'involves cross-border transmission' and 'does not involve cross-border transmission' respectively.

publicFile.label: Public File
publicFile.description: This field indicates whether the file is publicly accessible. It is a boolean type, accepting only `true` or `false`. `true` means the file is publicly accessible, while `false` means the file is not publicly accessible.

assetPort.label: Asset Port
assetPort.description: The network port number through which the asset provides external services. The port number must be an integer within the range of 0-65535.

icon.label: Icon
icon.description: This field is used to represent the graphical icon of an object, visually indicating specific entities or functionalities. Its value is the name or path of the icon file, typically in string format, such as filenames of common image formats like PNG, JPG, SVG, or ICO.

isv.label: Independent Software Vendor
isv.description: This field is used to identify the independent development service provider name of a website, application, or software product.

icp.label: Icp
icp.description: The ICP filing number is an Internet Content Provider registration number issued by the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, used to identify legally registered entities providing internet information services within China. This field is of string type, typically formatted as 'province abbreviation + ICP + numeric sequence + number'.

pubSecFilingNumber.label: Public Security Filing Number
pubSecFilingNumber.description: The Public Security Filing Number is a website filing identifier issued by public security authorities, used to identify the filing information of a website. The format typically includes administrative division codes, filing authority identifiers, and serial numbers.

url.label: URL
url.description: The URL field is used to record the complete address information of a Uniform Resource Locator (URL). This field is of string type and must comply with standard URL format specifications, typically including components such as the protocol (e.g., http, https), hostname, path, and optional query parameters and fragment identifiers.

copyright.label: Copyright
copyright.description: This field is used to declare copyright ownership information of digital content. It requires a string format providing explicit copyright owner names, organizations, or relevant declaration texts.

compatibility.label: Compatibility
compatibility.description: This field describes the compatibility range of software or hardware products with operating system versions. It typically specifies the supported operating system names, version numbers, and architecture requirements in text format.

officialAccountName.label: Official Account Name
officialAccountName.description: The official verified name of a public account, indicating the authenticated public account name on the WeChat Official Accounts Platform.

wechatSubjectName.label: WeChat Subject Name
wechatSubjectName.description: The name of the authenticated entity on the WeChat Official Account Platform, typically the official registered name of a business, organization, or institution.

wechatSubjectType.label: WeChat Subject Type
wechatSubjectType.description: Classification of authentication entity types on the WeChat Official Account Platform. Enumeration type, with optional values including: individual (individual entity), enterprise (corporate entity), government (government entity), media (media entity), other (other entities).

individual.label: Individual Entity
individual.description: WeChat Official Account entity for personal identity authentication

enterprise.label: Enterprise Entity
enterprise.description: Authenticated WeChat Official Account entity of an enterprise or organization

government.label: Government Entity
government.description: WeChat Official Account entity certified by government agencies

media.label: Media
media.description: WeChat Official Account entity authenticated by media organizations

other.label: Other
other.description: Other types of WeChat Official Account authentication entities

mainboard.label: Mainboard
mainboard.description: The motherboard field records the manufacturer and model information of the computer's motherboard. This field is of string type and is used to describe the motherboard hardware. It typically includes the motherboard manufacturer name, product series, or specific model.

memorySize.label: Memory Size
memorySize.description: Total memory capacity information, indicating the memory size of the target system or device. The format is a numerical value followed by a unit, typically GB or MB, e.g.: 3.68GB.

diskModel.label: Disk Model
diskModel.description: Hard disk model information, used to identify the specific hard disk model of the storage device. This field is of string type and typically consists of the model identifier defined by the manufacturer.

managementAddress.label: Management IP Address
managementAddress.description: Management IP address, used for out-of-band device management, remote access, and system maintenance. This field must be in a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address format.

networkInfo.label: Network Configuration Information
networkInfo.description: Network configuration information of network devices or virtual machines, including IP addresses and MAC addresses. The IP address format is dotted decimal notation, e.g., 192.168.1.1. The MAC address format supports colon-separated (xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx) or hyphen-separated (xx-xx-xx-xx-xx-xx), e.g., 70-00-55-98-C7-00. Multiple configuration items should be comma-separated.

env.label: Environment Variable
env.description: Environment variables refer to the variables set in the operating system or container, used to configure the runtime parameters of applications or systems. They are formatted as key-value pairs, typically represented as strings, with multiple pairs separated by commas and keys and values separated by colons.

systemRequirement.label: System Requirement
systemRequirement.description: Specifies the minimum or recommended system configuration requirements necessary for the proper operation of software or hardware products.

installPath.label: Install Path
installPath.description: The installation path refers to the directory location where an application or software is installed in the operating system. The value should be a valid file system path string.

assetAddress.label: Asset IP Address
assetAddress.description: The unique network identifier of an asset as recorded in the management system, used for locating and accessing the asset. Format requirements: must comply with standard IPv4 or IPv6 address formats, such as dotted-decimal notation (e.g., 192.168.1.1) or IPv6 colon-separated hexadecimal notation.

gateway.label: Default Gateway IP Address
gateway.description: Default gateway IP address, used to identify the egress gateway of network devices. It must comply with the IP address format specification, consisting of four decimal integers between 0 and 255, separated by dots, for example: 192.168.1.1.

vlanId.label: VLAN ID
vlanId.description: VLAN identifier, used to uniquely identify an IEEE 802.1Q virtual local area network. The format is string type, representing a numeric ID.

serviceType.label: Service Type
serviceType.description: Service type, used to identify the application service type exposed via network ports or running internally within the operating system on the endpoint side.

certType.label: Certificate Type
certType.description: Certificate type is used to identify the category of digital certificates for different security purposes. This field is an enumeration type, and its value must be one of the predefined options, including: SSL (SSL/TLS certificate), CodeSigning (code signing certificate), ClientAuth (client authentication certificate), Email (email certificate), EVSSL (extended validation SSL certificate), and other specified types if applicable.

SSL.label: SSL/TLS Certificate
SSL.description: Encryption for secure communication between websites and servers

CodeSigning.label: Code Signing Certificate
CodeSigning.description: Digital signature verification for software and code.

ClientAuth.label: Client Authentication Certificate
ClientAuth.description: Used for client authentication and mutual SSL authentication

Email.label: Email Certificate
Email.description: Used for email encryption and digital signatures.

EVSSL.label: EV SSL Certificate
EVSSL.description: Extended Validation SSL Certificate, providing the highest level of identity verification.

SelfSigned.label: Self Signed Certificate
SelfSigned.description: Certificate not signed by a third-party certificate authority

validTime.label: Valid Time
validTime.description: The validity period indicates the time range during which the certificate is valid, formatted as yyyy-mm-dd to yyyy-mm-dd. Both the start date and end date must comply with the standard date format, and the end date must be later than the start date.

securityGroupIds.label: Security Group ID List
securityGroupIds.description: This field represents a list of unique identifiers for the Security Groups assigned by the cloud service provider.

accessControlPolicy.label: Access Control Policy
accessControlPolicy.description: Configuration information of the access control policy, used to define access permission rules for resources. This field stores the specific policy configuration content, typically including structured information such as access control rules, conditions, and actions.

scanPortList.label: Scan Port List
scanPortList.description: This field records the set of target port numbers detected during network scanning activities. Each port number must be an integer type, with a valid range from 0 to 65535, representing valid port numbers.

scanIpList.label: Scan IP List
scanIpList.description: Record the set of target IP addresses detected during network scanning activities. Format requirement: Each element in the array must be a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address format.

deviceSerialNumber.label: Device Serial Number
deviceSerialNumber.description: The device serial number is a unique serial identifier assigned by the hardware manufacturer, used to uniquely identify the device.

isp.label: Internet Service Provider
isp.description: This field identifies the name of the Internet Service Provider (ISP), used to record carrier information for network traffic or event sources.

length.label: Length
length.description: Length indicates the size constraint of the target object, such as the maximum number of characters or numeric precision specified in a database column definition.

columnName.label: Column Name
columnName.description: The column name is the logical identifier of a data column in a database table, used to specify individual data fields.

columnType.label: Column Type
columnType.description: Column type indicates the data type classification of a database column, such as numeric, character, date, etc.

columnCount.label: Column Count
columnCount.description: This field indicates the total number of columns defined in the database table, and its value should be a non-negative integer.

icmpCode.label: ICMP Code
icmpCode.description: The ICMP response code indicates the response code returned in the ICMP protocol. This field is of string type and is used to identify the specific type or error status of the ICMP packet.

icmpType.label: ICMP Type
icmpType.description: This field represents the ICMP protocol message type code, used to identify the specific type of the ICMP message. The value must be a predefined enumerated string. Common optional values include: EchoReply, DestinationUnreachable, SourceQuench, Redirect, EchoRequest, etc.

dataSourceAddress.label: Data Source Address
dataSourceAddress.description: Data source address refers to the network address of the device providing the data. This field must be in a valid IP address format, supporting both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. IPv4 addresses use dotted-decimal notation (e.g., 192.168.1.5), while IPv6 addresses use colon-separated hexadecimal format.

pktsInAndOut.label: Total Packet Count
pktsInAndOut.description: Total packet count refers to the cumulative sum of data packets transmitted bidirectionally in a network interface or session. This field value is a non-negative long integer.

bytesInAndOut.label: Total Bytes In And Out
bytesInAndOut.description: This field is used to count the cumulative total of bytes transmitted bidirectionally in a network interface or session, i.e., the sum of inbound and outbound bytes. The value is a long integer representing the byte count and must be a non-negative integer.

softwareSerialNumber.label: Software Serial Number
softwareSerialNumber.description: Software serial number, used to uniquely identify software licensing. Typically composed of characters including digits, letters, and hyphens (-).

busSystemName.label: Business System Name
busSystemName.description: Name identifier of the business system, used to uniquely identify a business system. Format requirements: string type, length limited to 1-128 characters, supports Chinese and English letters, numbers, underscores, and hyphens, and cannot start or end with special characters.

busSystemVersion.label: Business System Version
busSystemVersion.description: The specific version number of the business system, formatted as a string type, typically following the format of major version.minor version.revision number.

busSystemId.label: Business System ID
busSystemId.description: Unique identifier of the business system, used to uniquely identify a business system.

systemIncludeDevList.label: System Include Device List
systemIncludeDevList.description: Device asset inventory, containing unique identification information such as device type, model, and serial number, used for asset tracking, inventory management, and security audits. It should include key details such as device brand, model, and serial number. Multiple device entries can be separated by commas or semicolons.

softwareList.label: Software List
softwareList.description: The software list field records an inventory of third-party applications and software components installed on the system or device. This field is of string type, and its content should be a comma-separated list of software names.

filePath.label: File Path
filePath.description: This field represents the storage directory path of the file in the file system. The path format should comply with the operating system specifications. For example, Windows systems use backslashes (\) as directory separators, while Linux/Unix systems use forward slashes (/).

attackerInfo.label: Attacker Information
attackerInfo.description: The attacker information field contains relevant details about the traced attacker, such as attacker account, name, email, etc. The field value is in string format and should include key attributes along with their corresponding values.

fileEncrypted.label: File Encrypted
fileEncrypted.description: This field indicates whether the file content is protected by encryption algorithms. The field is of boolean type, accepting only 'true' or 'false' values, representing encrypted and unencrypted file states respectively.

isCdn.label: Is CDN
isCdn.description: Identifies whether the target is a Content Delivery Network (CDN) node. This field is of boolean type, with possible values of true or false.

cdnVendor.label: CDN Vendor
cdnVendor.description: This field is used to identify the official name of the Content Delivery Network (CDN) service provider. The format is a string, typically the vendor's full commercial name or a commonly recognized abbreviation.

processCount.label: Process Count
processCount.description: This field indicates the total number of running processes associated with a specific event or asset on the current system or asset. Format requirement: must be a non-negative integer.

ipVersion.label: IP Version
ipVersion.description: This field indicates the version identifier of the Internet Protocol (IP). The format is a string, currently primarily including "IPv4" and "IPv6".

timesPermin.label: Attempts Per Minute
timesPermin.description: Count the number of specific operations or authentication attempts per minute. This field is of integer type, representing the frequency count of event occurrences, with a value that should be greater than or equal to 0.

sm3.label: SM3 Hash Value
sm3.description: File SM3 hash value, a cryptographic hash of the file content calculated using the SM3 algorithm. This value is a fixed-length hexadecimal string consisting of 64 characters, composed of digits 0-9 and lowercase letters a-f.

webTamperType.label: Web Tamper Type
webTamperType.description: Web page tampering type, used to identify the specific type of malicious modification to web page content, structure, or functionality. This field is an enumeration type, and its value must be a predefined string. Valid values include: contentReplacement (content replacement), hiddenLinkInjection (hidden link injection), visibleLinkInjection (visible link injection), jsScriptHijacking (JS script hijacking), metaTampering (page metadata tampering), other (other), etc.

contentReplacement.label: Content Replacement
contentReplacement.description: The attacker directly replaces the original content of the website, such as replacing the homepage with a defacement page or a show-off page.

hiddenLinkInjection.label: Hidden Link Injection
hiddenLinkInjection.description: Stealthily embedding malicious links in web pages, typically using SEO techniques to boost the search rankings of illicit websites, making them difficult to detect during normal browsing.

visibleLinkInjection.label: Visible Link Injection
visibleLinkInjection.description: Embedding links in the page that are clearly unrelated to the website's main content, including advertisements or links to prohibited content.

jsScriptHijacking.label: JavaScript Script Hijacking
jsScriptHijacking.description: By embedding malicious JS scripts, search engine crawlers are identified and tampered content is returned to perform traffic hijacking or redirection.

metaTampering.label: Metadata Tampering
metaTampering.description: Tampering with the TDK (Title, Description, Keywords) of a webpage, typically used for SEO cheating or redirecting to illegal websites.

islandPageInjection.label: Island Page Injection
islandPageInjection.description: Generate completely new, standalone pages containing prohibited content within the website directory, with no internal links referencing them.

other.label: Other Type
other.description: Unclassified other types of webpage tampering

vulOrg.label: Vulnerable System Vendor
vulOrg.description: This field is used to identify the original developer or manufacturer name of the vulnerable software or hardware product, such as the vendor of an operating system, application, or hardware device. The value is of string type. It is recommended to use the official commonly used name or abbreviation of the vendor, avoiding the use of abbreviations or internal code names.

vulCode.label: Vulnerability Code
vulCode.description: Vulnerability ID refers to the unique identifier of a vulnerability defined according to the format specified by national vulnerability databases such as CNVD and CNNVD. The format must comply with the corresponding standard numbering convention, typically structured as 'standard prefix-year-serial number,' for example, CNVD-YYYY-XXXXX or CNNVD-YYYY-XXX.

vulDescription.label: Vulnerability Description
vulDescription.description: Description of the vulnerability's technical characteristics and potential risks. This field contains a text string that should clearly and accurately explain the root cause of the vulnerability, technical details, potential exploitation methods, and possible security impacts.

vulDetector.label: Vulnerability Discoverer
vulDetector.description: The vulnerability discoverer field records the name of the individual, organization, or research team that first discovered and reported the vulnerability.

algorithm.label: Encryption Algorithm
algorithm.description: This field indicates the type of security algorithm used for data encryption, typically identified by standard algorithm names such as AES-256.

vulPublicTime.label: Vulnerability Public Disclosure Time
vulPublicTime.description: The exact time when the vulnerability was first disclosed in public channels. The required format is year-month-day hour:minute:second, i.e., yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm:ss.

vulName.label: Vulnerability Name
vulName.description: Standardized descriptive name of the vulnerability, used to uniquely identify a specific vulnerability type. Typically follows industry-standard naming conventions such as CVE IDs, CNVD IDs, or vendor-disclosed vulnerability advisory names.

createTime.label: Creation Time
createTime.description: This field records the initial creation time of a system object, file, or resource. The time format must be yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm:ss.

hostAddress.label: Host IP Address
hostAddress.description: Host IP address, used to identify the host's location in the network. It must comply with the IPv4 or IPv6 address format specifications. IPv4 addresses are in dotted-decimal notation, consisting of four decimal numbers ranging from 0 to 255, separated by dots. IPv6 addresses are in colon-separated hexadecimal notation.

exfiltrationChannel.label: Exfiltration Channel
exfiltrationChannel.description: This field identifies the specific channel through which data was transmitted externally in a data breach incident. The value must be a predefined enumeration string, with optional values including but not limited to: removableMedia (removable media), networkProtocols (network protocol transmission), emailSystems (email systems), messagingApps (instant messaging applications), cloudServices (cloud services), etc.

removableMedia.label: Removable Media
removableMedia.description: Copying data via removable media such as USB devices, external hard drives, and optical discs.

networkProtocols.label: Network Protocols
networkProtocols.description: Data transmission via network sharing protocols such as FTP, SMB, etc.

emailSystems.label: Email System
emailSystems.description: Data transmission via email systems including webmail and email clients.

messagingApps.label: Messaging Applications
messagingApps.description: Transmitting data through instant messaging applications such as WeChat, QQ, Telegram, etc.

cloudServices.label: Cloud Services
cloudServices.description: Upload and share data through cloud services such as online storage or cloud storage.

webInterfaces.label: Web Interface
webInterfaces.description: Data transmission through web interfaces such as HTTPS web forms and online services.

remoteConnections.label: Remote Connections
remoteConnections.description: Data transmission via remote connections such as remote control software, VPN, or Bluetooth.

physicalCapture.label: Physical Capture
physicalCapture.description: Capturing data through physical means such as printing, screenshots, clipboard operations, or photography.

databaseTools.label: Database Tools
databaseTools.description: Export large volumes of structured data through database management tools.

applicationApis.label: Application APIs
applicationApis.description: Bulk data retrieval and transmission through the application API interface.

transMode.label: Transmission Mode
transMode.description: The protocol mode used for data transmission, typically employed to specify the protocol format for file transfer or data exchange. This field is of string type, with common values being identifiers representing specific transmission modes, such as "netascii" (Network ASCII mode), "octet" (binary octet mode), or "mail" (mail mode).

modifyTime.label: Modify Time
modifyTime.description: Modification time indicates the last modified time of a file or object. This field is of string type and must adhere to the standard datetime format: yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm:ss.

wmiType.label: WMI Type
wmiType.description: Specific category classification of WMI event consumers, enumeration type. Optional values include: CommandLineEventConsumer (command-line event consumer), ActiveScriptEventConsumer (active script event consumer), NTEventLogEventConsumer (NT event log consumer), SMTPEventConsumer (SMTP event consumer), LogFileEventConsumer (log file event consumer), etc.

CommandLineEventConsumer.label: Command Line Event Consumer
CommandLineEventConsumer.description: WMI consumer type for executing command-line commands

ActiveScriptEventConsumer.label: Active Script Event Consumer
ActiveScriptEventConsumer.description: WMI consumer type for executing VBScript or JScript scripts

NTEventLogEventConsumer.label: NT Event Log Event Consumer
NTEventLogEventConsumer.description: WMI consumer type that writes entries to Windows Event Log.

SMTPEventConsumer.label: SMTP Event Consumer
SMTPEventConsumer.description: WMI consumer type for sending emails via SMTP

LogFileEventConsumer.label: Log File Event Consumer
LogFileEventConsumer.description: WMI consumer type for writing entries to log files.

affectAssetIp.label: Affected Asset IP Address
affectAssetIp.description: Affected asset IP address, referring to the IP address corresponding to the asset that was attacked or at risk in the security incident. This field is of string type and must comply with standard IPv4 or IPv6 address formats.

affectAssetPort.label: Affected Asset Port
affectAssetPort.description: This field represents the network service port number of the affected asset in an attack or risk scenario, used to identify network services. Format requirements: the port number must be an integer type with a valid range of 0-65535.

homePath.label: Home Path
homePath.description: This field represents the local path of the user's home directory or the resolved path from environment variables. The value should be a filesystem path string compliant with the operating system specifications, which may include drive letters, directory separators (such as backslashes `\` or forward slashes `/`), and environment variable references (e.g., `%USERPROFILE%` or `$HOME`).

timePasswordLastSet.label: Time Password Last Set
timePasswordLastSet.description: Records the timestamp of the user's last password modification in the format of yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm:ss.

latestActivityTime.label: Latest Activity Time
latestActivityTime.description: This field records the timestamp of the last activity or alert trigger in the security event. The format must be a standard datetime string, with specific requirements as follows: yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm:ss, for example, 2024-12-27 19:28:22.

closeReason.label: Close Reason
closeReason.description: This field is used to record the specific reason and resolution status for closing a security incident. The value should be of string type and concisely describe the reason for closing the event.

closeUser.label: Close User
closeUser.description: This field identifies the user or system entity that performed the event closure operation. Its value is of string type and is used to record the initiator of the closure operation.

alertDevices.label: Alert Devices
alertDevices.description: The alert source device field records a collection of security devices and sensor information that generated the alert, formatted as a string array. Each array element should be a string describing the device name and identification information, typically including key details such as device name and IP address.

alertNames.label: Alert Name List
alertNames.description: Alert name list, recording the collection of all alert rule names associated throughout the security event lifecycle. This field is a string array, where each element represents an alert name string.

alertIds.label: Alert ID List
alertIds.description: A collection of unique identifiers for all alerts associated with the security event. This field is a string array, where each element should be a string representing the unique identifier of an alert.

alertTypes.label: Alert Type List
alertTypes.description: A collection of all alert classification types associated with the recorded security event. The field value is a string array, where each array element represents an alert classification type string.

alertCount.label: Alert Count
alertCount.description: This field is used to count the total number of alerts associated with a security event. The value should be a non-negative integer representing the specific quantity of alerts.

attacker.label: Attacker
attacker.description: Attackers refer to the collection of all unique source IP addresses used in attack activities, serving to identify the origin of the attack. This field is of array type, where each element must comply with IP address format requirements, i.e., a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address.

victim.label: Victim IP Address Set
victim.description: A set of all unique target IP addresses affected by the attack, stored in an array format. Each element in the array must be a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address. IPv4 addresses should be in dotted-decimal notation (e.g., 192.168.1.1), while IPv6 addresses must conform to standard representation (e.g., 2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334 or compressed format).

srcAddrList.label: Source IP Address List
srcAddrList.description: This field records the set of all unique source IP addresses in a security event. The field value is a string array, where each array element must be a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address.

destAddrList.label: Destination IP Address List
destAddrList.description: The destination IP list records the collection of all unique destination IP addresses in a security event. This field is of array type, where each element must be in a valid IPv4 or IPv6 address format.

queryStatus.label: Query Status
queryStatus.description: The response status code of a DNS protocol query request, used to indicate the result of the DNS query operation. Among common status codes, 0 typically indicates a successful DNS query. This field is of string type, with specific values adhering to the status codes defined by the DNS protocol standard.

queryClass.label: Query Class
queryClass.description: The network class applicable to DNS queries. Optional values include: IN (Internet class), CH (Chaos class), HS (Hesiod class), NONE (no class), ANY (any class).

IN.label: Internet Category
IN.description: Internet protocol category, which is used for the vast majority of DNS queries.

CH.label: Chaos Category
CH.description: Chaos network category, used for specific system queries, may indicate reconnaissance activities.

HS.label: Hesiod Class
HS.description: Hesiod system category, used for specific network services.

NONE.label: None
NONE.description: No specific protocol category, used for update operations.

ANY.label: Any Category
ANY.description: Arbitrary protocol category, potentially indicating anomalous queries

fileCreateTime.label: File Create Time
fileCreateTime.description: The initial creation time of the file. The format must be yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm:ss, for example: 2023-10-15 14:30:00.

threatActorOrg.label: Threat Actor Organization
threatActorOrg.description: This field is used to record the names of known malicious organizations or threat actor groups.

nicModel.label: NIC Model
nicModel.description: NIC model refers to the hardware model identifier of the Network Interface Controller (NIC), used to uniquely identify the network interface device. It typically includes information such as manufacturer, interface type, and speed specifications.

privilegedRun.label: Privileged Run
privilegedRun.description: This field indicates whether the container is running in privileged mode with host access permissions, based on Docker runtime security standards. The format is boolean, allowing only `true` or `false` values.

shareProperty.label: Share Property
shareProperty.description: The shared attribute is used to define the sharing permissions and scope classification for various types of assets. This field is of enumeration type, and its value must be one of the predefined options and cannot be filled arbitrarily. Available options include: no_sharing (no sharing), internal_share (internal sharing), department_share (department sharing), partner_share (partner sharing), public_share (public sharing).

no_sharing.label: No Sharing
no_sharing.description: Assets are strictly prohibited from any form of sharing and are restricted to use by the owner only.

internal_share.label: Internal Share
internal_share.description: Assets can be shared within the organization but are prohibited from being provided to external parties.

department_share.label: Department Share
department_share.description: Assets can be shared within specific departments or business units.

partner_share.label: Partner Share
partner_share.description: Assets can be shared with authorized business partners.

public_share.label: Public Share
public_share.description: Assets can be publicly shared externally, provided they comply with relevant laws and regulations.

conditional_share.label: Conditional Share
conditional_share.description: Assets can be shared when specific conditions are met, such as after authentication and authorization.

openLevel.label: Open Level
openLevel.description: This field indicates the openness level of various assets (data, APIs, services, etc.), defining the scope of information access and dissemination. Its value is a predefined enumeration type and must be selected from the specified range. Available options include: confidential (confidential level), indicating highly sensitive information accessible only to a very limited number of authorized personnel; internal_use (internal use), indicating usage restricted to internal personnel within the organization; limited_disclosure (restricted disclosure), indicating that the information may be disclosed to limited external entities under specific conditions; public_disclosure (public level), indicating information that can be disclosed to the public; open_standard (open standard), indicating adherence to open standards and encouraging widespread use and interoperability.

confidential.label: Confidentiality Level
confidential.description: Highest sensitivity assets with strictly restricted access.

internal_use.label: Internal Use
internal_use.description: Assets limited to internal organizational use only, prohibited from external disclosure.

limited_disclosure.label: Limited Disclosure
limited_disclosure.description: Assets that can be disclosed externally under specific conditions.

public_disclosure.label: Public Disclosure Level
public_disclosure.description: Assets that can be made publicly accessible, compliant with open standards.

open_standard.label: Open Standard
open_standard.description: Compliant with open standards, freely usable and distributable assets

assetMacAddress.label: Asset MAC Address
assetMacAddress.description: The Media Access Control (MAC) address of the asset, used to uniquely identify network devices. The format must be a lowercase alphanumeric MAC address, consisting of six colon-separated hexadecimal groups, with each group containing two digits in the format xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx.

supervisoryUnitName.label: Supervisory Unit Name
supervisoryUnitName.description: This field indicates the name of the regulatory authority with oversight over the asset.

assetImportance.label: Asset Importance
assetImportance.description: Asset criticality level, used to indicate the priority and value of the asset in cybersecurity protection.

netId.label: Security Domain ID
netId.description: Unique identifier of the asset's security domain, primarily used to resolve security domain conflicts.

departmentHeadName.label: Department Head Name
departmentHeadName.description: This field indicates the name of the department head.

departmentHeadPhone.label: Department Head Phone Number
departmentHeadPhone.description: Mobile phone number of the department head. Format requirements: Must be in a valid mobile phone number format.

departmentHeadMail.label: Department Head Email
departmentHeadMail.description: The email address of the department head, used for receiving relevant notifications and contact purposes. Format requirements: must comply with the standard email address format, including a valid username and domain name separated by the @ symbol.

maintainStartTime.label: Maintenance Start Time
maintainStartTime.description: Maintenance start time refers to the commencement time of asset maintenance, using the standard datetime format: yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm:ss.

maintainEndTime.label: Maintenance End Time
maintainEndTime.description: The end time of asset maintenance, using the standard datetime format: yyyy-mm-dd HH:mm:ss.

assetRegion.label: Asset Region
assetRegion.description: The logical deployment location of the asset, such as DMZ zone, internal network, etc.

assetConfidentiality.label: Asset Confidentiality
assetConfidentiality.description: This field indicates the confidentiality level of the asset, used to assess the potential impact degree of unauthorized information disclosure.

assetIntegrity.label: Asset Integrity
assetIntegrity.description: Integrity level, indicating the potential impact degree of unauthorized tampering with the asset.

assetUsability.label: Asset Usability
assetUsability.description: This field indicates the extent to which the asset can operate as expected and provide services.

isCriticalProtection.label: Critical Infrastructure Protection Status
isCriticalProtection.description: Indicates whether the asset is classified as critical infrastructure requiring special protection measures. This field is of boolean type, with possible values of true or false.

protectionLevel.label: Protection Level
protectionLevel.description: This field indicates the asset level determined in accordance with the Critical Information Infrastructure Protection classification system.

idc.label: IDC Service Provider
idc.description: This field represents the service provider name of the Internet Data Center (IDC) hosting the asset. The field value is of string type and requires the use of standardized, complete data center provider names.

isCriticalInfra.label: Is Critical Infrastructure
isCriticalInfra.description: Indicates whether the asset belongs to critical infrastructure as defined by national standards. This field is of boolean type and only accepts true or false values.

isClassified.label: Is Classified
isClassified.description: Indicates whether the asset contains or processes classified information. This field is of boolean type, with values strictly limited to true or false, representing 'yes' and 'no' respectively.

cabinetPosition.label: Cabinet Position
cabinetPosition.description: Cabinet location is used to identify the physical position of the asset within the rack.

unitAffiliation.label: Unit Affiliation
unitAffiliation.description: This field indicates the direct regulatory relationship classification of the asset's affiliated organization, used to identify the organization's position within the administrative hierarchy.

central_government.label: Central Government
central_government.description: Institutions directly managed and led by the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China, the State Council, or their constituent departments.

provincial.label: Provincial
provincial.description: Institutions directly managed and led by the provincial, autonomous region, or municipal governments or Party committees.

municipal.label: Municipal
municipal.description: An institution directly managed and led by the municipal (prefecture-level) government or Party committee of a districted city.

district_county.label: District County
district_county.description: An institution directly managed and led by municipal districts, county-level cities, or county governments.

other.label: Other
other.description: Other affiliations not explicitly categorized under the aforementioned levels.

assetOwnerPhone.label: Asset Owner Contact Information
assetOwnerPhone.description: Contact information of the asset owner, used to identify the contact phone number of the responsible party for the asset.

assetOwnerMail.label: Asset Owner Email
assetOwnerMail.description: Responsible person's email address, used to identify the email address of the asset owner. The format must comply with standard email address specifications, including a valid username and domain name part.

assetGeoProvinceCode.label: Asset Geographic Province Code
assetGeoProvinceCode.description: The administrative division code of the province where the asset is located, using the national standard administrative division code format.

assetGeoCityCode.label: Asset Geographic City Code
assetGeoCityCode.description: Administrative division code of the city where the asset is located, using the national standard administrative division coding format.

assetGeoCity.label: Asset Geo City
assetGeoCity.description: The name of the city where the asset is currently located, represented in string format.

company.label: Vendor Name
company.description: This field records the full legal registered company name of the software vendor or service provider. The standard full company name should be used, avoiding abbreviations or acronyms.

product.label: Product Name
product.description: This field represents the product name of the software or application associated with the process or file. The format is a string, typically including the software vendor and product name, and supports special characters such as registered trademark symbols (e.g., ®).

serviceImage.label: Service Image Path
serviceImage.description: The full path and parameters of the process file where the service resides, represented in string format, supporting inclusion of the file name and startup parameters.

startType.label: Start Type
startType.description: This field indicates the startup type of a service or program, describing its launch method, such as automatic, manual, or disabled.

oldStartType.label: Original Startup Type
oldStartType.description: This field records the original boot method before modification, used to identify the boot configuration state of the system or service prior to the change.

newStartType.label: New Start Type
newStartType.description: The new startup method refers to the updated startup approach after service configuration modifications.

executeType.label: Execution Type
executeType.description: This field indicates the execution method of the command, used to identify the mechanism or protocol through which the command is executed, such as local execution or remote execution via WinRM (Windows Remote Management). The field is of string type and should use meaningful descriptive values, such as 'local' for local execution and 'remote' for remote execution.

assetUserMail.label: Asset User Contact Email
assetUserMail.description: Contact email of the asset user, used for security communication. Format requirements: must comply with standard email address format, including '@' symbol and valid domain name.

assetProtectStatus.label: Asset Protection Status
assetProtectStatus.description: Operational status of asset security protection mechanisms or services.

under_protection.label: Under Protection
under_protection.description: The security protection services for the asset (such as firewalls, endpoint protection, intrusion detection, etc.) are operating normally and effectively.

unprotected.label: Unprotected
unprotected.description: The asset is either not enabled or has not deployed any active security protection measures.

unknown.label: Unknown
unknown.description: The protection status of the asset could not be detected or obtained, resulting in an unclear security posture.

relateId.label: Related ID
relateId.description: Correlation ID is a unique identifier used to associate related security events or asset information, formatted as a string.

wmiName.label: WMI Name
wmiName.description: WMI name refers to the class name, property name, or namespace path in Windows Management Instrumentation. Its format typically follows WMI naming conventions, such as class names like Win32_Process or namespace paths like root\cimv2.

certIssuer.label: Certificate Issuer
certIssuer.description: The name of the certificate issuer, which identifies the authority or entity that issued the certificate. This field is of string type and typically contains the Distinguished Name (DN) or Common Name (CN) of the Certificate Authority (CA). The value must comply with the format conventions for issuer names as specified in the X.509 certificate standards.

sessionId.label: Session ID
sessionId.description: Session ID is a unique global identifier used to identify network connections or application sessions.

softwareVersion.label: Software Version
softwareVersion.description: Software version number, used to identify the release version of the software. It typically follows the format of major version.minor version.revision number (e.g., 15.6.1) or may include an alphabetic prefix (e.g., v15.6.1).

deviceVendor.label: Device Vendor
deviceVendor.description: Name of the manufacturer or vendor of the hardware device or software product, used for asset identification, vulnerability impact analysis, and supply chain security management.

responseMsg.label: Response Message
responseMsg.description: The response body records the message content returned after network requests, system processing of requests, reply requests, or initiation of operational behaviors.

srcTransMacAddress.label: Source Translated MAC Address
srcTransMacAddress.description: The converted source MAC address refers to the source MAC address displayed in the packet after undergoing MAC address conversion (e.g., proxy, tunnel encapsulation) or being affected by network attacks (e.g., ARP spoofing) during Layer 2 network transmission. This field must comply with the standard MAC address format, which consists of six two-digit hexadecimal numbers separated by colons, in the format: xx:xx:xx:xx:xx:xx, where x is 0-9 or a-f.
